commit_message:
Rename requires files to standard names.

Rename tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt and tools/test-requires
to test-requirements.txt. These are standard files, and tools in the
general world are growing intelligence about them.

Change-Id: I903213fda94a833335abaa7ad9a90bbb688ec15a
Fixes: bug #1179008

commit_message:
Add db test that checks that shadow tables are up-to-date

This is finally patch for bp db-improve-archiving.
It add new test that checks that:
1) there is no extra shadow tables
2) for each table we have shadow table
3) Tables and shadow tables have the same columns.

blueprint db-improve-archiving

Change-Id: If037ccbb80a880777e8bc2224b0847ccf9413ea2

commit_message:
Sync shadow table for 159 migration

To be able to use db archiving our table and shadow table should
have the same columns.

fixes bug 1179507

Change-Id: Ia8a0271505d374456a9ff14d314e80af9bad4a2b

commit_message:
Sync shadow table for 157 migration

To be able to use db archiving our table and shadow table should
have the same columns.

fixes bug 1179504

Change-Id: I08485630a0e31252084e48d403f56da6866e0475

commit_message:
Sync shadow table for 156 migration

To be able to use db archiving our table and shadow table should
have the same columns.

fixes bug 1179502

Change-Id: Ibb0d4708d949d53e17e91307f07bb90a11b9a990

commit_message:
OpenShiftAutoScaling and OpenShift feature parity.

Updates OpenShiftAutoScaling.template with fixes contained in
OpenShift.template.

Nodes do scale when the hard-coded cfn-push-stats value is raised
above the threshold.

Change-Id: I79051a15a5116034d06fd95b5cc8c3412eda33a8

commit_message:
diskimage-builder elements for openshift-origin

These have been used to deploy a working openshift stack.

They pre-install more images than the oz templates, based on the yum
log of extra installs during boot time.

Change-Id: Icb246033964e1388aeebdd4229790acfe0e17718

[{'created': '2013-05-26 15:15:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add MethodNotAllowed and Conflict exception classes

It is expected to recieve a 405 or a 409 from Nova, but novaclient presents
them as a generic ClientException. This patch adds MethodNotAllowed
and Conflict classes to represent these HTTP responses.

Change-Id: If89cee04ebd74daaa28ea30b5c57cdc63edc1551
'}]
commit_message:
Add MethodNotAllowed and Conflict exception classes

It is expected to recieve a 405 or a 409 from Nova, but novaclient presents
them as a generic ClientException. This patch adds MethodNotAllowed
and Conflict classes to represent these HTTP responses.

Change-Id: If89cee04ebd74daaa28ea30b5c57cdc63edc1551

[{'created': '2013-05-28 04:58:31.000000000', 'message': "Tidy up and make OpenShift.template work

With these changes it is now possible to launch the wordpress
gear on the node.

Changes include:
- set environment variables at the start of the UserData and use them
  throughout instead of heat refs
- set /etc/resolv.conf to point at the broker's bind
- on the broker run setsebool -P httpd_unified=on
  oo-accept-broker suggested this was necessary, and the console errored
  until it was set
- enforce selinux, it was left in permissive mode

Change-Id: I28c9ce4b19f4a0aa59ef514a269ae30b6fb9f6fa
"}, {'created': '2013-05-29 00:36:06.000000000', 'message': "Tidy up and make OpenShift.template work

With these changes it is now possible to launch the wordpress
gear on the node.

Changes include:
- set environment variables at the start of the UserData and use them
  throughout instead of heat refs
- set /etc/resolv.conf to point at the broker's bind
- on the broker run setsebool -P httpd_unified=on
  oo-accept-broker suggested this was necessary, and the console errored
  until it was set
- enforce selinux, it was left in permissive mode
- setsebool httpd_unified needs to be set on the broker
- node /etc/resolv.conf needs to be overwritten after puppet apply
- Outputs for console URL and nameserver entry for DNS resolution of apps

Change-Id: I28c9ce4b19f4a0aa59ef514a269ae30b6fb9f6fa
"}]
commit_message:
Tidy up and make OpenShift.template work

With these changes it is now possible to launch the wordpress
gear on the node.

Changes include:
- set environment variables at the start of the UserData and use them
  throughout instead of heat refs
- set /etc/resolv.conf to point at the broker's bind
- on the broker run setsebool -P httpd_unified=on
  oo-accept-broker suggested this was necessary, and the console errored
  until it was set
- enforce selinux, it was left in permissive mode
- setsebool httpd_unified needs to be set on the broker
- node /etc/resolv.conf needs to be overwritten after puppet apply
- Outputs for console URL and nameserver entry for DNS resolution of apps

Change-Id: I28c9ce4b19f4a0aa59ef514a269ae30b6fb9f6fa

commit_message:
Add CONTRIBUTING.rst file.

We don't use github pull requests, but we'd like to make that clear
to people if they show up at github and try to do one. github will
display the content of this file on the pull request submit form
if it's there.

Change-Id: I25e5b65b02244e100da4e5717ded09fcc0f33741

commit_message:
Don't delete sys_meta on instance delete

Unfortunately, we require to access instance_system_metadata to get
data (specifically at least instance_type data) for instances that have
been deleted.

There's 2 cases where this is true:

1) nova-api supports showing deleting instances when you specify a
'changes-since' param.
2) The _usage_audit_log periodic task pulls all instances during the
audit period, which includes instances that have been deleted during
that period.

This reverts commit 17bca438954638d74035d560e826a26a532b3ea3, which was
attempting to fix a bug where we leave instance_system_metadata entries
undeleted from the DB.  There's not an easy way to query for the deleted
sys_meta data in an efficient manner, and leaving the entries undeleted is
the lesser of the 2 evils for now.

Fixes bug 1185190

Change-Id: I898f0546c49126dcc56a4237120082f95dc82304

commit_message:
Fix volume IO usage notifications been sent too often.

Each compute node was sending out volume IO usage notifications
for all the volumes in use in the system. This include volumes
hosted on the other compute nodes duplicating the events.

Fix this by getting the conductor to send out the IO usage
notification event immediately after it updates the volume usage
cache table, and only for the effected volume.

Fixes: bug 1182102

Change-Id: Id3216caa482110bdec2b7f5ea13050112e4da009

commit_message:
Add missing os.path.abspath around csrfile.

We need to make sure paths are absolute before passing them to openssl.

Fixes bug 1185052

Change-Id: I3ba9dd0a01d0078f830c33ac3173259985790060

some initials comments"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (3 inline comments)

I have questions about the usecase. My question is a relationship between dhcp options and ports. I understand dhcp options for pxe boot may be different port by port in baremetal environment. Is there a care where multiple ports share a same set of dhcp options? It this a usual case?

I am thinking a case where a couple of tftp servers exist, there are thousands of ports associated with dhcp options and one tftp servers fails, dhcp options of hundreds or thousand of ports are updated. If many ports refers a small number of a set of dhcp options, it looks better to split a database model into two (or three): sets of dhcp options and port-to-dhcpopts mapping. (The former may be split into more models).

I am not sure what is expected usecases? it is appreciated if you share the plans of baremetal provisioning. It must be helpful to understand and look for the better solution.


My inline comments are minor. Other reviewers already pointed a number of points to be addressed.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

As other reviewers commented, could you continue the review here? The same patch in two reviews is confusing and it forces reviews to do duplicated works...'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(12 inline comments)

Hi,
I have added a number of inline comments.

I have a number of issues with the patch set:

1. The DHCP options on the port. Could you please clarify why this is done per port and not per subnet. Each quantum subnet has a flag that indicates if there is DHCP support. My understanding would be that you would have highly available and redundant servers for the pxe boot.

2. As mentioned in one of the previous comments i think that it may be more elegant to have metadata per primitive (the way that the dhcp options is implemented is similar to how the db support will be for the metadata). So I do not think that performance is an issue here.

Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Here are some links to further information on the baremetal use case. 

  # see the Services section in particular
  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Baremetal
  
  # see slide 32 in particular
  http://www.slideshare.net/devananda1/ods-havana-provisioning-bare-metal-with-open-stack

  # recording of my talk using the above slide deck
  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zzPt-NdJlVY'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

RE: Akihiro's comments:

> My question is a relationship between dhcp options and ports. I understand dhcp options for pxe boot may be different port by port in baremetal environment.

Correct.

> Is there a care where multiple ports share a same set of dhcp options? It this a usual case?

Yes, but there will only be a few ports with the same options. All the ports on a single machine will share the same options, since we may not know which port will come up first. So if we imagine a deployment with 10K baremetal nodes, and each node has 2 NICs with 2 ports, we have 40K options in total -- but still 10K unique options.

> I am thinking a case where a couple of tftp servers exist, there are thousands of ports associated with dhcp options and one tftp servers fails, dhcp options of hundreds or thousand of ports are updated. 

It is always possible for something to fail... :)

> If many ports refers a small number of a set of dhcp options, it looks better to split a database model into two (or three): sets of dhcp options and port-to-dhcpopts mapping. (The former may be split into more models).

This, however, doesn't fit our use case. If one tftp server (nova-compute host, right now) were to fail, we would need to update the dhcp options for all the ports for all the baremetal nodes which were managed by that nova-compute host. However, these options are not going to be identical, so splitting the schema as you suggest will only make it more complicated, not less."}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

I grok'd garyk's concern! see inline comment :)"}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

RE: garyk's comments (and summarizing what we talked about on IRC)


> 1. The DHCP options on the port. Could you please clarify why this is done per port and not per subnet. Each quantum subnet has a flag that indicates if there is DHCP support. 

See my comments to Akihiro's questions. tl;dr; each baremetal node (physical machine) will have a different tftp config file.

> My understanding would be that you would have highly available and redundant servers for the pxe boot.

At the moment, nova-baremetal doesn't support any HA. There were some plans by USC/ISI to contribute a shared-filesystem-based approach. That has been abandoned in favor of this solution: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/baremetal-compute-takeover

Ironic will follow the same approach when it is able to.

> 2. As mentioned in one of the previous comments i think that it may be more elegant to have metadata per primitive (the way that the dhcp options is implemented is similar to how the db support will be for the metadata). So I do not think that performance is an issue here.

I don't quite follow this -- I haven't dug into quantum's data model, so I'm not sure what you mean by "metadata per primitive". Could you give an example?


Thanks,
Devananda'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

Ack, this is a perf issue: In my head it should be a single query to bring back the ports to write *and* their options. Possibly also do the optimisation for identical port values at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

see inline comments'}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Putting -1 for adding a query per each port"}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(14 inline comments)

-1 for database issues.

Some of issues points that corresponding lines are not covered by unit tests.
Please check them by running tox -e cover

Also I would like you to change commit message in according to guidelines"}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Copying comments from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30441"}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Abandoned

continued on with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30441/'}]

commit_message:
blueprint Make it possible to pxeboot ports.

added the udpate cli port test.
added the body out part to port.py

Changed the paramter name opt_list to opt_value
and addedd parameter pair matchs in the create
port section as is in the update port section.

Change-Id: Ica500f92e835ad6cfbb3c4bf31efa26bcc002fe8

commit_message:
Using unicode() to handle image's properties

Replace str() to unicode() to allow nova-api work well with the fix I
did in glanceclient (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29245/6).

Fixes: Bug #1180377

Change-Id: I31e532bb50e12e355b9dd26c9ce1e129da858cbe
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <lzy.dev@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2013-05-29 05:05:56.000000000', 'message': "Update the ubuntu static path for dashboard

With Grizzly the default static path for the Django front-end has
moved from /usr/share/pyshared to /usr/share/openstack-dashboard. This
change moves this forward to support Grizzly's default paths on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I036191e2811e3ba4dc36114e5af748e8427f0ea6
"}]
commit_message:
Update the ubuntu static path for dashboard

With Grizzly the default static path for the Django front-end has
moved from /usr/share/pyshared to /usr/share/openstack-dashboard. This
change moves this forward to support Grizzly's default paths on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I036191e2811e3ba4dc36114e5af748e8427f0ea6

commit_message:
Fix undefined variable in cache

A function to verify metadata in the cache middleware was falling over
for GETs on images with a missing size.

Fixes bug 1183049

Change-Id: I2da75e5e5aca12d20a10cace2a3779e4041161b2

commit_message:
Remove execute permissions from test files.

Remove execute permissions from test_volumes.py and
test_storwize_svc.py, which caused the tests defined in them
to be skipped.

Fixing the permissions caused test_create_volume_with_volume_type to
execute, which fails. The cause of the failure is that
(1) LoggingVolumeDriver doesn't implement get_volume_stats(), and
(2) The fake RPC doesn't pass the statistics to the scheduler for
some reason.

Because this test doesn't test the scheduler, just change to use the
simple scheduler and work around the issue.

Change-Id: Ie01331d484c5c48c78b626eff1ad793dbbe7182c
Fixes: bug 1183416

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-05-06 17:48:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

After going through most of this, I'm now confused as to why we're copying all this code over the place and what the new extension framework gives us over the old framework. Christopher, could you provide some insights to that?"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-05-07 02:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Hi Christopher,

This patch is good to understand how to apply this framework to the existing APIs. Good job :-)

And I write some comments to understand this framework deeply.'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-07 05:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

Jay - the large chunks of cut and paste are primarily a nature of the V2->V3 work. Since we're making quite a few backwards incompatible changes, complete duplication followed by eventual removal of the V2 tree say in the "J" or later time frame seemed to be the most appropriate approach rather than attempting to support both APIs in the same chunk of code which could get very complicated. That of course comes at a maintenance cost until V2 is deprecated.

The new API extension framework uses stevedore to manage a lot of the complexity of handling plugins rather than the custom code we currently have. Loading, having hooks for deciding which plugins should go in, and iterating over extensions is all handled by stevedore. The custom import code can eventually be removed when V2 goes away.

Entry points have the advantage of making it easy to load extensions regardless of where they are installed on the system. No requirement to have them in the nova tree or modify the config. Adding an extension could be as easy as doing a pip install of the appropriate package. The V3 extensions framework has all the details looked after by stevedore/extension points. Still needs more discussion, but it would also be possible to move all non core API functionality plugins into their own repository.

Using entry points such as in servers.py also allows us to design extensions to be extendible without modification to the extension itself. So for example the ServerController allows other extensions to modify the kwargs to instance creation. With the V2 servers.py code we have hard coded extension specific code in servers.py which means extensions are not nearly as independent as we'd like them to be.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-05-07 06:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-07 13:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I like the way this is going, and understand the need to allow extensions to extend create without having to modify the create function directly.

However, we're going to have to find a way to do a better job of documenting what extension adds support for what option - the current API docs don't do this, but at least you can see the full set of options in the code.

Can we add an API call perhaps which uses the same extension mechanism to return the list of options supported by the currently loaded extensions - sort of make the V£ API itself  inspectable ?"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-13 01:19:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Phil,

For starters I think we do need to have better documentation. The documentation for the extension should also show what core areas it extends, not just for the resources it adds.

It would be nice to have the API inspectable as well, but I'm not sure what that should look like. Perhaps we can add something at a later date that can be queried from /extensions. Do you have any suggestions? 

I've added a note about at least adding this information to the doco blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/v3-api-specification"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-13 03:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-13 04:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-05-27 14:56:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

One more question on the policy name.

Also, the other rather large item I'm struggling with in this and dependent patches is the amount of copied code.  Please don't hate me for not having a stronger opinion on this earlier.  :-)

I'm wondering if there should be some refactoring to share code between v2 and v3 APIs.  Perhaps a new directory like:

nova/api/openstack/compute/shared/

and nova/api/openstack/compute/shared/servers.py would be code used by both the v2 and v3 API implementations.  We can have a giant ugly warning in all files here warning people that changing code here affects both v2 and v3 APIs, and reviewers will have to be careful with changes to code in this directory.  As functionality diverges and it doesn't make sense to share the code, then it can be copied down into the v3 plugin.

Would it help if I prototyped something to see what it looked like?"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-27 15:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-06 13:11:15.000000000', 'message': "API Extensions framework for v3 API Part 2

This is the second patch for the new extension framework
which is only to be used by the Nova v3 API.

- Adds tracking of extensions loaded and allows
  extensions access to this information
- Adds core API functionality as extensions
  - 'server'
    - Adds an entry point that other extensions can
      use to modify the server create arguments without
      having to modify the server extension itself
    - TODO: Will have to add more entry points as other
      extensions are ported. Delaying adding entry points
      now so they can be tested as they are added.
- Adds port of os-keypairs extension
  - This is an example of a controller extension in the new
    framework
  - This is an example of using the server extension entry
    point to add functionality without modify the core API code
  - Ports tests for the os-keypairs extensions
    - Adds v3 API fake specific code for tests

This completes the bulk of the new extension framework. Porting
of the server tests will be done in future changesets as more
of the core API is ported across as the tests are dependent
on multiple core APIs.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-extension-framework

Change-Id: Ibadb5bbe808c27d2f4afebe65c06a92576397085

commit_message:
API Extensions framework for v3 API Part 2

This is the second patch for the new extension framework
which is only to be used by the Nova v3 API.

- Adds tracking of extensions loaded and allows
  extensions access to this information
- Adds core API functionality as extensions
  - 'server'
    - Adds an entry point that other extensions can
      use to modify the server create arguments without
      having to modify the server extension itself
    - TODO: Will have to add more entry points as other
      extensions are ported. Delaying adding entry points
      now so they can be tested as they are added.
- Adds port of os-keypairs extension
  - This is an example of a controller extension in the new
    framework
  - This is an example of using the server extension entry
    point to add functionality without modify the core API code
  - Ports tests for the os-keypairs extensions
    - Adds v3 API fake specific code for tests

This completes the bulk of the new extension framework. Porting
of the server tests will be done in future changesets as more
of the core API is ported across as the tests are dependent
on multiple core APIs.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-extension-framework

Change-Id: Ibadb5bbe808c27d2f4afebe65c06a92576397085

commit_message:
doc: fix hyphens instead of underscores for 'os*' conf options

The ceilometer documentation, on the configuration page,
list some options with hyphens (e.g. 'os-tenant-id') which are unknown options:
underscores are required instead (e.g.: 'os_tenant_id').

Fixes: bug #1177002
Change-Id: Iea9c53f628df0b3bed06206e9b2241ed949131fa
Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30725/

commit_message:
Import strutils from oslo, and convert to it.

The only change of behaviour here (according to the former glance
unit tests) is that 'T' now means True not False. I suspect that's
ok.

Change-Id: Icf98f913a3f78a1fe2f38a82a25a071c2da03739

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-05-29 14:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Akihiro,

sorry again for not updating the spec.
In a nutshell enable_dnat has been removed because external_gateway_info is an attribute which defines how traffic coming from internal router interfaces is forwarded. And here the options are just snat/no snat.

For floating IPs, whether they're enabled or not shouldn't probably be regulated by external_gateway_info. I realised that when during the implementation I found that disabling floating ips, and disabling nat resulted in totally different code paths.
Nachi had also a good comment that disabling dnat does not really mean "disable floating IPs"; indeed a floating IP has both a SNAT and a DNAT rule.

So I have removed at the moment the whole concept, as it does not belong to this blueprint. However, it will be implement later on. I am thinking of adding a 'enable_floating_ip' attribute directly to the router resource. I could make this as an extension too, or even add to this extension. However, since its bw compatible it's a good argument that this attribute should go into core directly.

I also agree with your comment on the change to the extension framework. I did not do that for avoiding stacking too many patches one on top of the other.
Probably this particular change can be made independent - and note that this has no unit tests, as we currently are completely lacking unit tests for validation how extensions are loaded (another item that the community might tackle).'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-05-29 14:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-29 14:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-29 14:41:01.000000000', 'message': "Configurable external gateway modes

Blueprint l3-ext-gw-modes

This patch introduces an API extension for enabling or disabling
source/destination NAT on the router gateway interface, and implements
support for this extension in the l3 agent, which has also been
refactored in order to ensure SNAT rules are applied (or removed)
in a single place in the process_router routine.
The patch therefore enables the extension on all plugins which
leverage this agent.
In this patch the validate_boolean function is re-introduced, as it
used for validating a field of the external_gateway_info dict.
It is also worth noting that this patch attempts a different approach
to unit tests, where most of the 'infrastructure' is either mocked
or stubbed out.

Change-Id: Ia80cb56135229366b1706dd3c6d366e40cde1500
"}, {'created': '2013-05-29 14:41:01.000000000', 'message': 'Configurable external gateway modes

Blueprint l3-ext-gw-modes

This patch introduces an API extension for enabling or disabling
source/destination NAT on the router gateway interface, and implements
support for this extension in the l3 agent, which has also been
refactored in order to ensure SNAT rules are applied (or removed)
in a single place in the process_router routine.
The patch therefore enables the extension on all plugins which
leverage this agent.
In this patch the validate_boolean function is re-introduced, as it
used for validating a field of the external_gateway_info dict.
Also, unit tests for this patch do not load the whole infrastructure
but limit themselves to test the newly introduced db mixin.

Change-Id: Ia80cb56135229366b1706dd3c6d366e40cde1500

commit_message:
Configurable external gateway modes

Blueprint l3-ext-gw-modes

This patch introduces an API extension for enabling or disabling
source/destination NAT on the router gateway interface, and implements
support for this extension in the l3 agent, which has also been
refactored in order to ensure SNAT rules are applied (or removed)
in a single place in the process_router routine.
The patch therefore enables the extension on all plugins which
leverage this agent.
In this patch the validate_boolean function is re-introduced, as it
used for validating a field of the external_gateway_info dict.
The resource extension process is also slightly changed so that an
API extension can specify which extension should be processed before
its attributes can be processed. This is needed to ensure the
proper validator for external_gateway_info is installed.

Change-Id: Ia80cb56135229366b1706dd3c6d366e40cde1500

commit_message:
Fix tox coverange env

We're not setting the VIRTUAL_ENV environment variable, so 'tox -ecover'
is failing because patch_tox_venv uses the variable.

Change-Id: I3898d0dd1f8a9bf4216253bb2c7d8491e1e8ce56

commit_message:
Explicitly set downloadcache in tox.ini.

The latest tox 1.4.3 requires the user to explicitly set downloadcache
options.

Fixed bug 1185393.

Change-Id: Iacb63df40147b89b0eb16acd8b750951cbbce204

commit_message:
Use default user SSH credentials

Use default user SSH credentials rather than forcing the
'releasestatus' user and creds in ~/.gerritssh. This allows
to run locally with your own credentials for testing.

Change-Id: I497f338197cb5ba6c39aa0e5d8b001382ea1f3f5
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/30882
Approved: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>
Reviewed-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary checks for MultipleResultsFound

fixes bug 1185080

MultipleResultsFound exception is never thrown because model
queries are filtered by their primary key.

Change-Id: Id4a4ff84e134d3f1d177509193c4a14f830dfcc9

commit_message:
Add support for dnsmasq version 2.48

Following the bug fix for bug 1170793 we are able to add
in support for dnsmasq versions that do not support tags.

2.48 is the version shipped in RHEL 6.4

Change-Id: Ia7d2b1c0adb477159ce146bcd4323d4b2795bff5
(cherry picked from commit 6012b7e97c361a90d88a573d3c6a9f33e03f4281)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-08 11:25:17.000000000', 'message': "Add KEYSTONE_LOCALEDIR env variable

Part of fixing bug #995287

Syncs these two commits from oslo-incubator:

  Support overriding oslo localedir too
  Add a gettextutils.install() helper function

to get a new gettextutils.install() function which allows the default
localedir to be overwritten via an environment variable.

A few things to note:

 - gettextutils.install() is called before any other keystone modules
   are imported since modules can attempt to translate strings at
   import time. We can later add something like sphinx's lazy
   translation proxy to handle this case.

 - the gettext.install() call is moved from common.config to the
   toplevel scripts to fix cases (e.g. the legacy auth_token middleware)
   where keystone code might be imported by a program who's default
   translation domain is not 'keystone'.

 - we add a gettext.install() call in keystone.test so that tests have
   the _() builtin installed.

Change-Id: I86562b3a65d371673bb21f7179eecc7602bc0775
"}, {'created': '2013-05-20 22:05:14.000000000', 'message': "Add KEYSTONE_LOCALEDIR env variable

Part of fixing bug #995287

Syncs these two commits from oslo-incubator:

  Support overriding oslo localedir too
  Add a gettextutils.install() helper function

to get a new gettextutils.install() function which allows the default
localedir to be overwritten via an environment variable.

A few things to note:

 - the gettext.install() call is moved from common.config to the
   toplevel scripts to fix cases (e.g. the legacy auth_token middleware)
   where keystone code might be imported by a program who's default
   translation domain is not 'keystone'.

 - we add a gettext.install() call in keystone.test so that tests have
   the _() builtin installed.

Change-Id: I86562b3a65d371673bb21f7179eecc7602bc0775

  Support overriding oslo localedir too
  Add a gettextutils.install() helper function

   toplevel scripts to fix cases (e.g. the legacy auth_token middleware)

   translation domain is not 'keystone'.

Change-Id: I86562b3a65d371673bb21f7179eecc7602bc0775

commit_message:
Add KEYSTONE_LOCALEDIR env variable

Part of fixing bug #995287

Syncs these two commits from oslo-incubator:

  Support overriding oslo localedir too
  Add a gettextutils.install() helper function

to get a new gettextutils.install() function which allows the default
localedir to be overwritten via an environment variable.

A few things to note:

 - the gettext.install() call is moved from common.config to the
   toplevel scripts to fix cases (e.g. the legacy auth_token middleware)
   where keystone code might be imported by a program who's default
   translation domain is not 'keystone'.

 - we add a gettext.install() call in keystone.test so that tests have
   the _() builtin installed.

Change-Id: I86562b3a65d371673bb21f7179eecc7602bc0775

It seems like it would be simpler to add the cleanup functions in setupUpClass, and just remove the tearDownClass all together."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-03-14 20:38:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

see previous comment"}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-03-14 21:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sean, we still need to have the teardown function to be called by nose in case the setup is successful. 
This is only to handle the case of failure during the setup itself. In case of failures during the tests nose will continue and finally call the teardown.
This is meant to be as a temporary solution until we get proper resource management and test runner in place, and thus I also wanted to change as less as possible on test classes.
The decorator can be put on the setup method of any base class or test class which risks to create resources.
The alternative I see would be to put try/except directly into the setup fixture itself.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-22 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-22 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

I have seen several commits  in the meantime to fix the actual tests and avoid leaking resource.
However if there is a general interest in this kind of approach I'm happy to revive this change."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-14 14:13:37.000000000', 'message': 'Resource cleanup for failures in fixtures.

Using nose test runners, failures in setUpClass fixtures
are handled by skipping to the next test class.
Teardown fixture is not called.
Furthermore, even if teardown is called, in case a resource
was not setup, it will fail on AttributeError.
Fixing both here with a decorator and a __getattr__
implementation in the meta class for BaseCompTest.
This could be extended to other base classes.

Fixes LP# 1155150

Change-Id: Ib34b6a90f0bbd790a11197c914437c3c1749553a
'}, {'created': '2013-03-14 15:28:46.000000000', 'message': 'Resource cleanup for failures in fixtures.

Using nose test runners, failures in setUpClass fixtures
are handled by skipping to the next test class.
Teardown fixture is not called.
Furthermore, even if teardown is called, in case a resource
was not setup, it will fail on AttributeError.
Fixing both here with a decorator and a __getattr__
implementation in the meta class for BaseCompTest.
This could be extended to other base classes.

Fixes LP# 1155150

Change-Id: Ib34b6a90f0bbd790a11197c914437c3c1749553a
'}]
commit_message:
Resource cleanup for failures in fixtures.

Using nose test runners, failures in setUpClass fixtures
are handled by skipping to the next test class.
Teardown fixture is not called.
Furthermore, even if teardown is called, in case a resource
was not setup, it will fail on AttributeError.
Fixing both here with a decorator and a __getattr__
implementation in the meta class for BaseCompTest.
This could be extended to other base classes.

Fixes LP# 1155150

Change-Id: Ib34b6a90f0bbd790a11197c914437c3c1749553a

commit_message:
Remove direct depend on setuptools_git.

pbr brings this in, and will stop bringing it in when we refactor
a few things, so go ahead and drop the direct depend on it.

Change-Id: I5417403ee83b6df112e6a5ae49c17b7280250630

commit_message:
Renames tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt

and tools/test-requires to test-requirements.txt

These are standard files and tools in the
general world are growing intelligence about them.

Change-Id: Iac3c680dd19cabd8ea38598a6e2bb27238030a2d
Fixes: bug #1179008

commit_message:
Adding help text to the options that did not have it.

Many of the config options did not have help text set.  This patch
adds text for those.

patchset2 adds 5 skipped options

patchset3 adds a missing underscore before the helptext bracket

patchset4 fixes pep8 errors

patchset5 notes the units (seconds) in sql_retry_interval, as noted
by Flavio Percoco Premoli

patchset6 fixes comments from Alex Meade

Fixes bug: 1162449
Change-Id: Ic75e499456e389df2ec527594bbcd54c0b464ee3

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-28 20:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

also, does this mean explicit urls aren't going to work?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-28 21:01:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

See also Ibfff85177b8d26c5d9e88a2fd6c44bfd52f01db4

These all seem to work fine as catalog URLs:

 http://.../foo.tar.gz
 http://.../foo.tar.gz#egg=bar
 http://.../foo.tar.gz#egg=bar-0.1

the issue is you're trying to use:

 http://.../foo.tar.gz#egg=bar==0.1

but AIUI that's not a valid dependency_links URL

It's really PBR we need to fix here, I think"}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:46:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi,

It seems, that if the link does not contain the version information, it won't be used at all.

$ pip install -r req.txt -f http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config --log piplog
$ pip freeze | grep oslo.config
oslo.config==1.1.1
$ grep tarballs piplog 
  * http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config
  Could not parse version from link: http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config (from -f)
  Skipping link http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config (from -f); wrong project name (not oslo.config)
  Skipping page http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config because of Content-Type: application/x-gzip

Whereas with the version number, it is working:

$ pip install -r req.txt -f http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a2 --log piplog
$ pip freeze | grep oslo
oslo.config==1.2.0a2"}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Aborting, as this is not the solution for our pain.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-29 11:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Wow, that "Skipping link" stuff is new behaviour to me :('}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-28 13:33:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix url based requires

If an explicit URL is specified inside requires, the devstack scripts
used the full url to pass as a -f to pip install. pip requires -f to be
a catalog. This change adds an awk string operation, so that only the
url basename will be passed to pip as a find links parameter.

Change-Id: I4813d2a6a0c99d552238835ad6a96a5050aed400
'}, {'created': '2013-05-28 17:28:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix url based requires

If an explicit URL is specified inside pip-requires, which results as
the full url in "*.egg-info/dependency_links.txt", devstack passes the
full url as a -f to "pip install". pip seems to require the value of -f
to be a catalog. This change adds an awk string operation, so that only
the url "dirname" will be passed to pip as a find links (-f) parameter.

Change-Id: I4813d2a6a0c99d552238835ad6a96a5050aed400
'}]
commit_message:
Fix url based requires

If an explicit URL is specified inside pip-requires, which results as
the full url in "*.egg-info/dependency_links.txt", devstack passes the
full url as a -f to "pip install". pip seems to require the value of -f
to be a catalog. This change adds an awk string operation, so that only
the url "dirname" will be passed to pip as a find links (-f) parameter.

Change-Id: I4813d2a6a0c99d552238835ad6a96a5050aed400

commit_message:
Make passing user token to registry configurable

This patch adds CONF.use_user_token as a config option. When true, glance will
continue to use the user token when communicating with glance registry. When
false, glance will read admin credentials from the config and use those to
communicate with glance registry. Using admin credentials allow for
reauthentication when tokens expire and prevents requests from silently failing.

DocImpact
Fixes bug 1182536

Change-Id: Ia6b563677eb67d4069571c82b9dad3f025b6e9fb

commit_message:
Make testr preserve existing OS_* env vars values

Values for OS_TEST_TIMEOUT, OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE and OS_STDERR_CAPTURE
environment variables are fixed in .testr.conf now. It should be possible
to override them for each tox/runtests.sh call or for the current shell
session without making changes to .testr.conf.

Fixes bug 1182416.

Change-Id: I6c7839fa78b53ac8ea358ce0143a00931da96a9e

commit_message:
Clean up failed image transfers in instance spawn

Boot one instance with powervm driver, will transfer the image
file to host. Need clean up failed image transfers that may occur
during instance spawn.

Fixes bug #1173017

Change-Id: Iff5ecd32e201333567a6a4de1d3796e78ea5dc0c

commit_message:
Add documentation on reserving a Glance image

This lets us refer to the fact that some optional headers are in fact
required unless reserving an image.

Fixes bug 1124224

Change-Id: I5646d4dc130efecf991573b363eb1a665012b7df

'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-29 07:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hey,

thanks for taking care of this. I wonder, Should this patch be split in multiple patches, each enabling 1 hacking check?'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-05-29 08:09:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Some changed lines are fixes several hacking checks at the same time, and at most all of the fixes are docstring-related, so I think that it's not better to split the patch. Are there any obvious advantages of the such approach?"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-29 08:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dividing the patch would be a good idea since we should let each patch have one purpose.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-05-29 09:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Dividing the patches, makes it easier to identify why a change was made and to revert a patch, if a mistake was made.  Also it makes more thorough reviews possible.'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

My main cons is that in fact dividing is equals to rewriting patch from scratch :(

If it's really so important than I'll create new patches."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:49:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hey,

I understand your concern but I'd definitely prefer having more granular patches. I'd suggest you to have a separate clone and apply the patch partially.

Sorry about that!"}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:53:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, I'll do it."}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

This patch will be separated to the several patches - one per enabled hacking check.'}]

commit_message:
Enable some hacking tests

* H201  no 'except:' at least use 'except Exception:'
* H401  docstring should not start with a space
* H402  one line docstring needs punctuation
* H403  multi line docstring end on new line
* some style bugs fixed w/o enabling tests
* notes about ignored hacking tests added to tox.ini

Change-Id: Iaaecc4e2303fe90ca0b719a0e3e8b087760abeca

messages:

"}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

I am testing it now'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/30745/2/check/gate-quantum-requirements/53 : SUCCESS in 7s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30745/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/7356 : SUCCESS in 1m 41s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/30745/2/check/gate-quantum-docs/6595/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 33s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30745/2/check/gate-quantum-python26/6969 : SUCCESS in 16m 07s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30745/2/check/gate-quantum-python27/6976 : SUCCESS in 11m 52s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30745/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/25650 : FAILURE in 22m 02s
"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Wow, I didn't think this would work at all, but it does pass through to quantum.egg-info/requires.txt as:

  oslo.config==1.2.0a2

Which should work ...

(Still looking into this)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hmm, well ... let's make it

  http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config>=1.2.0a2

i.e. we don't require exactly 1.2.0a2"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

And now I see this in the devstack failure:

 sudo HTTP_PROXY= HTTPS_PROXY= NO_PROXY= python setup.py develop
 ...
 Searching for oslo.config==1.2.0a2
 Best match: oslo.config 1.2.0a2
 Downloading http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config==1.2.0a2
 Processing oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz
 Running oslo.config-1.2.0a2/setup.py -q bdist_egg --dist-dir /tmp/easy_install-se2gYO/oslo.config-1.2.0a2/egg-dist-tmp-0KNCSW

... so easy_install can handle this URL just fine?

Python packaging, go home. You're drunk."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Error is:

 sudo PIP_DOWNLOAD_CACHE=/var/cache/pip HTTP_PROXY= HTTPS_PROXY= NO_PROXY= /usr/bin/pip install -r quantum.egg-info/requires.txt -f http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config==1.2.0a2
 ...
 Downloading/unpacking oslo.config==1.2.0a2 (from -r quantum.egg-info/requires.txt (line 20))
   Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement oslo.config==1.2.0a2 (from -r quantum.egg-info/requires.txt (line 20)) (from versions: )

Hmm'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, I think this goes back to what Johannes was saying a long time ago ...

The URL we pass to pip was to be one of:

  http://.../foo.tar.gz
  http://.../foo.tar.gz#egg=bar
  http://.../foo.tar.gz#egg=bar-0.1

and it doesn't like either of these:

  http://.../foo.tar.gz#egg=bar==0.1
  http://.../foo.tar.gz#egg=bar==0.1

i.e. this works for me:

 [markmc@f17 quantum]$ python-pip freeze | grep oslo.config
 oslo.config==1.1.1
 [markmc@f17 quantum]$ grep oslo.config quantum.egg-info/requires.txt
 oslo.config>=1.2.0a2
 [markmc@f17 quantum]$ sudo python-pip install -r quantum.egg-info/requires.txt -f http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz#egg=oslo.config-1.2.0a2
 Downloading/unpacking oslo.config>=1.2.0a2 (from -r quantum.egg-info/requires.txt (line 1))
   Downloading oslo.config-1.2.0a2.tar.gz (76kB): 76kB downloaded
  Running setup.py ...
  ...
 Installing collected packages: oslo.config
   Found existing installation: oslo.config 1.1.1
     Uninstalling oslo.config:
       Successfully uninstalled oslo.config
   Running setup.py install for oslo.config
     ...
 Successfully installed oslo.config
 Cleaning up...
 [markmc@f17 quantum]$ python-pip freeze | grep oslo.config
 oslo.config==1.2.0a2

In the end, we need to get a change into PBR to allow us to pass the version number through to requires.txt without screwing up the URL in dependency_links.txt

I think we're still stuck with the same conclusions in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-May/009586.html"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, for havana-1, I think we've run out of time

I've proposed a revert of the dep on oslo.config 1.2.0 here: Idf89ca418df158e6f94279c9c5fa44f23073a9d7

We'll need to revisit this problem ASAP though"}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Does not seem to work'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

This change would not solve the issue, abandoning it.'}]

commit_message:
Fix oslo.config url

The oslo.config url did not contain the version string, thus the
requires.txt in the egg info did not contain the version string, so the
egg was not picked up at all.

Change-Id: Ibfff85177b8d26c5d9e88a2fd6c44bfd52f01db4

commit_message:
Verify that CONF.compute_driver is defined

The compute_driver parameter is a mandatory parameter only for nodes
running the Nova compute service. However Other Nova services like
Nova API actually call the compute_driver_matches() function.

Change-Id: Iac7cd46c6bdb4268cfbc650dcde0c95e69545f04
Fixes: bug #1184641

commit_message:
hbase metaquery support

- move HBase configuration comment to docs

- store metadata in resource table with prefix "r_"

- get_resources and get_meters, get_samples support metaquery

- enable api v1 metaquery tests

Change-Id: I3285bb420283c2385e6f340ff30e951d58dcb450
Implements: blueprint hbase-metadata-query
Fixes: bug #1146655

commit_message:
Fixes encoding issues for nova api req body.

* Ensure utf-8 encoding for POST/PUT body for api requests
* As per https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Encoding.

Fixes bug #1180344

Change-Id: Iea0f16b0c024795fb3aee1cd38bb54ee9da6d90d

subject: Rename requires files to standard names
messages:
[{'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-05-29 09:07:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As indicated in Launchpad, this bug was already assigned to Jiri who submitted a patch fixing this yesterday:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30679/

When a bug is already assigned to someone, it's usually good form to first ask the assignee if they are still working on it, before taking it on.

Please consider spending some time reviewing the existing patch rather than duplicating the effort. Thank you!"}, {'account_id': 6610, 'date': '2013-05-29 09:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

Rename tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt and tools/test-requires
to test-requirements.txt. These are standard files and tools in the
general world are growing intelligence about them.

Fixes: Bug #1179008
Change-Id: I72af39de297d0602d59e05f5e71c1aea4409d458

commit_message:
Rename requires files to standard names

From bug report:
Rename tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt and tools/test-requires
to test-requirements.txt. These are standard files and tools in the
general world are growing intelligence about them.

Fixes: Bug #1179008
Change-Id: I72af39de297d0602d59e05f5e71c1aea4409d458

commit_message:
Use exec_dirs for rootwrap commands

Avoid depending on platform specific paths for rootwrap
by using exec_dirs in rootwrap. Fixes rootwrap configuration
for SUSE.

Fixes bug #1156044

Change-Id: I54d082c543fd84b40db0caa3571300ac0bb07b57

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-27 20:10:50.000000000', 'message': "Catch and report errors from copy image to volume.

The copy image-to-volume errors weren't being handled
properly and the result was the lvcreate being retried
even though the lvcreate itself succeeded.

The result of this was misleading errors stating that
the volume couldn't be created because it already existed
(which it did, becuase the create itself was succesful).

This patch introduces a new exception for the failed image
copy process and if caught will update the volume status
to error and skip the retry process.

Fixes bug: 1183283

Change-Id: I23f05fe64475c3efe285e05a258c4625b801375c
"}, {'created': '2013-05-27 22:31:45.000000000', 'message': "Catch and report errors from copy image to volume.

The copy image-to-volume errors weren't being handled
properly and the result was the lvcreate being retried

(which it did, becuase the create itself was succesful).

Fixes bug: 1183283

Change-Id: I23f05fe64475c3efe285e05a258c4625b801375c
"}, {'created': '2013-05-27 22:32:46.000000000', 'message': "Catch and report errors from copy image to volume.

The copy image-to-volume errors weren't being handled
properly and the result was the lvcreate being retried
even though the lvcreate itself succeeded.

The result of this was misleading errors stating that
the volume couldn't be created because it already existed
(which it did, becuase the create itself was succesful).

Fixes bug: 1183283

Change-Id: I23f05fe64475c3efe285e05a258c4625b801375c
"}, {'created': '2013-05-29 05:58:03.000000000', 'message': "Catch and report errors from copy image to volume.

The copy image-to-volume errors weren't being handled
properly and the result was the lvcreate being retried
even though the lvcreate itself succeeded.

The result of this was misleading errors stating that
the volume couldn't be created because it already existed
(which it did, becuase the create itself was succesful).

Fixes bug: 1183283

Change-Id: I23f05fe64475c3efe285e05a258c4625b801375c
"}]
commit_message:
Catch and report errors from copy image to volume.

The copy image-to-volume errors weren't being handled
properly and the result was the lvcreate being retried
even though the lvcreate itself succeeded.

The result of this was misleading errors stating that
the volume couldn't be created because it already existed
(which it did, becuase the create itself was succesful).

Fixes bug: 1183283

Change-Id: I23f05fe64475c3efe285e05a258c4625b801375c

where previously they did not, so unit tests need to stub out the sleep if
they were not already doing so.

'}]
commit_message:
Get rid of extra delays in unit tests

Some resource types will now have at least one sleep during their creation
where previously they did not, so unit tests need to stub out the sleep if
they were not already doing so.

Change-Id: I1ae919263c6f12d9219970f226019e53daff052b

commit_message:
Proper creation of policy.json

The template definition had an unnecessary not_if
which would never allow for the template to get created
as policy.json is distributed by the package.
We have a similar policy.json being created in the cinder cookbook

Change-Id: Ic19e53157c70194dd68d68ba448a3403a3b8d1d3

commit_message:
Add l3 attribute to network

The fix is to add l3 attribute(s) to the returned objects in get_network() and get_networks()

Fixes: bug #1180971
Change-Id: I4b9c932fae90a169ad1c0119f45e90a2ee260acd
(cherry picked from commit eb6182fa6192b1ae4268ac02583622978d449a09)

subject: Implement copy_volume_to_image and copy_image_to_volume
messages:
[{'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-05-21 11:59:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 6984, 'date': '2013-05-21 12:07:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

See Avishay's comment"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-05-21 12:09:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What about the need for _ensure_shares_mounted()?  If it's needed, maybe the implementation here should have that and then call the superclass's method?  If it doesn't need it, then no work to be done."}, {'account_id': 6984, 'date': '2013-05-21 12:42:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Well, it could make sense. But this will ensure that nothing happened to the mount before fetching the image from glance and then convert it to raw.

This sounds a bit overkill, don't you think? However this will ensure that the volume is really available. I guess the convertion to raw implies the check."}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-05-21 12:50:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't know if it's overkill...could be.  I'm not a glusterfs developer.  I saw that the code checks that that the FS is mounted in various places, but don't know what the policy is.  I'm fine with it either way, as long as the gluster people are happy with it. :)"}, {'account_id': 6984, 'date': '2013-05-21 13:25:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not a gluster developer either, but I think this check is applicable to every storage driver relying on a distributed filesystem (such as NFS, Nexenta, Scality), so the patch should be replicate to all of them.

Should I retry something then?"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-05-21 13:30:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure.  Maybe ask the gluster folks for their opinion.  In my opinion, it makes sense for the checks to be in the base class."}, {'account_id': 6984, 'date': '2013-05-21 13:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-05-21 15:31:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This was just covered in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29591/"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-05-21 15:37:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Eric, I agree with you, and that's what I said as well.  However, looking at the glusterfs code, I see that at some points they ensure that the FS is mounted, and mount if not.  Does the generic code need something like this?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-17 11:10:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes snapshot image size issue on Hyper-V

Fixes bug: #1177927

The VHD file size reported while updating the Glance image differs
slightly from the actual image size, due to additional headers in the VHD
format.

This patch adds the correct value in the "size" metadata.

Change-Id: I60d468148d7cf6d7015f6e0629a41d3d6fef2b8d
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes snapshot image size issue on Hyper-V

Fixes bug: #1177927

The VHD file size reported while updating the Glance image differs
slightly from the actual image size, due to additional headers in the VHD
format.

This patch adds the correct value in the "size" metadata.

Change-Id: I60d468148d7cf6d7015f6e0629a41d3d6fef2b8d

"presumably cause breakage"? Are you seeing issues in heat?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-21 14:11:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-05-21 19:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have issues on ubuntu vms launched by heat because ubuntu only packages boto 2.3.

commit_message:
heat-cfntools requires boto >= 2.5.2.

Older versions are untested and presumably cause breakage.

Change-Id: Ifeca91104ae4b9dbcebd9a0c68e31ec666ef7c84

Looks like this is still an issue in the current oslo rpc service class so I've restored the change and synced it back up."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-20 20:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/13953/3/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/1747 : SUCCESS in 1m 25s

- http://logs.openstack.org/13953/3/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/1707 : SUCCESS in 3m 30s
'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-05-20 22:36:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This would break Connection.close() and cleanup()."}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2013-05-20 22:51:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Eric, Can you elaborate a little?

I've not noticed any breakage with this patch - we've been running it for quite a while and never noticed any RPC related exceptions, or an increase in our RabbitMQ connections."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-05-21 18:33:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We have Connection.close() and driver cleanup() methods that are supposed to end all consumers and as much as possible, clean up the connections and unload the driver. The driver cannot unload if code from this driver is running in unknown thread groups.

These methods are called by unit tests. I expect the ZeroMQ driver will leak file descriptors during the unit tests following this change. I'd have to investigate to see if something similar might be true with Rabbit.

Anyway, these methods aren't really used in the typical case as in, say, Nova where the service launches, creates consumers, and runs until it dies or is killed. You're right, doing functional testing around that general use-case won't discover any problems with this patch...

However,  I think some projects such as heat might be looking to create ephemeral consumers.

The last couple design summits have featured discussions around cleanly reloading processes, reloading configuration, etc. These close and cleanup methods will be essential to that.

Finally, MarkMc is working on a new RPC API that will expose the eventlet thread spawning. I think this will provide what you're looking for."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

Change-Id: Ie13e0d7bf82bc3366e9c5ab1cb063fc96a4463ac
'}]
commit_message:
Support RPC consumption in a thread group.

Additionally, the RPC service class has been updated to make use of this feature.

Fixes bug 1050371.

Change-Id: Ie13e0d7bf82bc3366e9c5ab1cb063fc96a4463ac

It depends on which quantumclient is installed in the system. I confirmed your patch works ok.

- On my ubuntu 12.04 "/opt/stack/quantum/bin/quantum-debug -vvv --config-file=/etc/quantum/debug.ini help" displays the same result as yours, but "/usr/local/bin/quantum-debug -vvv --config-file=/etc/quantum/debug.ini help" just displays a simple help provided by cliff.
- After I removed /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/quantumclient/, I got your result. quantumclient under dist-packages was installed by quantum pip-requires.

Thanks,'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Added reload_config_files() function.

Added ConfigOpts.reload_config_files() function to reload the options
from configuration files.

This is part of the blueprint service-restart.

Change-Id: I560155ca0e3b5366149b3b0c7cad0ed11b21aee5

commit_message:
Add XML support to test_server_basic_ops

* Added test to add security group & rule to server instance
* Added test to delete security group rule & security group after
server termination
* Addded XML client for pause, unpause, suspend, resume in
server_clients.py
* Added XML support in test_server_basic_ops

Partially Implements: blueprint missing-tempest-tests

Change-Id: I55962a01021d378ff1bcf104f0c75a8a8d196490

commit_message:
Prevent rescuing a VM with a partially mounted volume.

If a VM goes into rescue mode with a partially mounted volume, the
volume won't re-appear after the VM is unrescued.

Fix bug 1158942

Change-Id: I1e104236c41c59e67a0f0e9ef26143c57f6e0094
(cherry picked from commit 5ada427935a0664f6c2534163f9988fb85d7b6ca)

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-05-14 20:14:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

I agree that everything should be consistent. Some of this is due to historical issues in devstack's service catalog. We should fix the inconsistency by bringing the one outlier into line with the rest.

However, without great cause I'm not convinced that changing the default is the best thing to do. Horizon can live on an internal management network or external. That's what the setting is for. Changing the default is a backwards-incompatible thing to do and without strong evidence I'd rather not touch that.

Can you provide further reasoning for why it's insufficient for people who need to use the internalURL (or any other) to change the setting?"}, {'account_id': 7541, 'date': '2013-05-14 20:28:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The comment in the local_settings.py indicates that the default is 'internalURL', however, that is only true for horizon-keystone interactions. 

Changing the default in the local_settings.py would be sufficient, but at some point the description of the OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE settings needs to be reconciled with its actual meaning.

Also, it seems more correct that horizon should communicate on internal channels to the other services rather than the public interface which could introduce additional network latency in large scale environments with load balancers and proxies on the public side.

In any event, it is not a critical problem for most people and it can be corrected by changing the local_settings parameter."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
horizon should default to internalURL in 'url_for' function

All of the horizon client API modules, except for keystone, default to
using the publicURL value from the service catalog when looking up url
values.  There are use cases where the publicURL is not exposed or
defined, but leaving publicURL undefined causes some critical operations
to fail.

The horizon keystone client defaults to internalURL, which should be
the rule for all horizon intra-service communications.

Fixes bug: 1178690

Change-Id: I52deb105413a26bb492af9f445ee74f1695c2680

I'm not convinced this is a valid API change."}, {'account_id': 7148, 'date': '2013-05-14 05:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I notice that some other defects pointing to this issue. 
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1153926

To Sean,
Do you have any strong reasons for showing the deleted flavor? For showing the delete flavor with the running VM configured with the deleted flavor? Actualy if nova flavor-show <deletedflavorname>, it will not display the flavor also. This operation result now is not keep sync. 

Also
Another situation is if user delete flavor 5->create flavorid 5 with different configurations->delete flavor 5 again,
In current design, it will list the first of the deleted flavor 5.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-05-14 11:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The issue here is not whether the proposed behavior is preferable to the old behavior. This is an incompatible API change in the sense that valid programs using the nova API may stop working after this change. A bug/issue has to be very severe to justify such a change and it is not clear this issue qualifies. The change could be made safely in v3. That said, if the nova PTL and Core team really think this change is necessary I would not stand in the way.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-05-14 16:15:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It seems to me that this is a somewhat complex issue that is going to require a more complex fix to resolve properly.  In the meantime, I feel like it's almost better to have the two different methods providing different results - at least it's possible to look up a deleted flavor this way (although as Zhu Zhu pointed out, there are still problems with that).

Would a blueprint be appropriate to track the API change needed to fix this?"}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2013-05-14 21:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

As far as I understand, the deleted flavor is needed for instances that are launched already with that flavor, say during a resize.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-29 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2013-05-26 00:02:27.000000000', 'message': 'Update cloned volumes QoS settings.

The SolidFire device inherits all settings (including QoS) from
the parent on a clone.  This meant that although we were expecting
QoS to be updated when a clone was issued with a different Volume
Type than the parent volume it was never acted upon.

This change fixes that bug by simply adding the *new* qos settings
to the ModifyVolume call after cloning.

Fixes bug: 1184235

Change-Id: I81786a07312027d543b9f06e54dfbf57e6085bc9
'}, {'created': '2013-05-27 18:04:41.000000000', 'message': 'Update cloned volumes QoS settings.

The SolidFire device inherits all settings (including QoS) from
the parent on a clone.  This meant that although we were expecting
QoS to be updated when a clone was issued with a different Volume
Type than the parent volume it was never acted upon.

This change fixes that bug by simply adding the *new* qos settings
to the ModifyVolume call after cloning.

Fixes bug: 1184235

Change-Id: I81786a07312027d543b9f06e54dfbf57e6085bc9
'}]
commit_message:
Update cloned volumes QoS settings.

The SolidFire device inherits all settings (including QoS) from
the parent on a clone.  This meant that although we were expecting
QoS to be updated when a clone was issued with a different Volume
Type than the parent volume it was never acted upon.

This change fixes that bug by simply adding the *new* qos settings
to the ModifyVolume call after cloning.

Fixes bug: 1184235

Change-Id: I81786a07312027d543b9f06e54dfbf57e6085bc9

commit_message:
Raise exception instances, not exception classes.

Raising raw exception classes works, but is old deprecated syntax, and
may bite us later.

Change-Id: I03f41da267ce5cbfc5ea98c531acc9a9b13e082a

commit_message:
Restore heat.db.sync and add Deprecated message.

This unpythonic deprecation method is used because this module was only
ever meant to be used from the CLI as 'python -m heat.db.sync'. The
module should be removable in Havana+1.

Fixes bug #1185220

Change-Id: I9943e5c35d9578f899fae1d11b818a2a5a9167c0

commit_message:
Use heat-manage to initialize Heat db.

Since this commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30580/
calling the heat.db.sync module no longer works
and firstboot fails with "No module named heat.db.sync".

Also depends on this patch in heat to fix heat-manage
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30690/

Change-Id: Iaf862e03a1f3f0ed2d2ddd83a8ead2a5f287789e

commit_message:
Remove path_exists from NFS/GlusterFS drivers

mkdir -p will not throw an error if the path already exists,
so this method is unneeded in these classes.

Change-Id: I65a67cb75f83f65a6f80c7a90f77c2c5133bd41b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-29 00:22:00.000000000', 'message': "Tidy up and make OpenShift.template work

With these changes it is now possible to launch the wordpress
gear on the node.

Changes include:
- set environment variables at the start of the UserData and use them
  throughout instead of heat refs
- set /etc/resolv.conf to point at the broker's bind
- on the broker run setsebool -P httpd_unified=on
  oo-accept-broker suggested this was necessary, and the console errored
  until it was set
- enforce selinux, it was left in permissive mode
- setsebool httpd_unified needs to be set on the broker
- node /etc/resolv.conf needs to be overwritten after puppet apply
- Outputs for console URL and nameserver entry for DNS resolution of apps

Change-Id: I13a9ca0dd5ba4f0d12c86d8c24c7660cee07054e
"}]
commit_message:
Tidy up and make OpenShift.template work

With these changes it is now possible to launch the wordpress
gear on the node.

Changes include:
- set environment variables at the start of the UserData and use them
  throughout instead of heat refs
- set /etc/resolv.conf to point at the broker's bind
- on the broker run setsebool -P httpd_unified=on
  oo-accept-broker suggested this was necessary, and the console errored
  until it was set
- enforce selinux, it was left in permissive mode
- setsebool httpd_unified needs to be set on the broker
- node /etc/resolv.conf needs to be overwritten after puppet apply
- Outputs for console URL and nameserver entry for DNS resolution of apps

Change-Id: I13a9ca0dd5ba4f0d12c86d8c24c7660cee07054e

commit_message:
Add update method of security group name and description

make it possible to edit the name and description of
common security groups, we can not rename the default.

Fixes: bug #918393

Change-Id: Id6e02cd1054452889282b3ff4fb04b2071980cc8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-25 23:42:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix ownership transfer when cloning with SolidFire

When cloning a volume with SolidFire driver, the owner of
the cloned volume is not set correctly in SolidFire when there is
a transfer of ownership.

This results in inconsistent states where the cloned volume
is owned by the new tenant in Cinder but SolidFire thinks it is still
owned by the original volume's tenant.

This patch adds the newAccountID parameter to all CloneVolume calls.

If the cloned volume is owned by the same tenant, newAccountID will
be set to the same value as the original SolidFire volume. There
will be no change of ownership done by the cloning process in SolidFire.

If the cloned volume should be owned by a different tenant, newAccountID
will be set to the appropriate SolidFire account corresponding
to the new tenant. If the SolidFire account does not exist already,
it will be created.

Fixes: bug #1183521
Change-Id: I622ca2962478298e3e0c5a26866e39919805075f
(cherry picked from commit af023fe0cce3b8ef2b90ec37f1bc49feb17eac83)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ownership transfer when cloning with SolidFire

When cloning a volume with SolidFire driver, the owner of
the cloned volume is not set correctly in SolidFire when there is
a transfer of ownership.

This results in inconsistent states where the cloned volume
is owned by the new tenant in Cinder but SolidFire thinks it is still
owned by the original volume's tenant.

This patch adds the newAccountID parameter to all CloneVolume calls.

If the cloned volume is owned by the same tenant, newAccountID will
be set to the same value as the original SolidFire volume. There
will be no change of ownership done by the cloning process in SolidFire.

If the cloned volume should be owned by a different tenant, newAccountID
will be set to the appropriate SolidFire account corresponding
to the new tenant. If the SolidFire account does not exist already,
it will be created.

Fixes: bug #1183521
Change-Id: I622ca2962478298e3e0c5a26866e39919805075f
(cherry picked from commit af023fe0cce3b8ef2b90ec37f1bc49feb17eac83)

commit_message:
Test for remote directory creation before shutting down instance

This patch moves the creation of the directory on the migration target
earlier in the code path so we can catch failures like missing or incorrect
keypairs on the source and destination node.

This fixes part of bug #1061024 but not all of it yet.

Change-Id: I097cf007cdd8de0c9c3a9390cbc6dc202eddb2b5

commit_message:
RingBuilder.add_dev returns device id

When added a new devices into builder the add_dev function returns it
unique id.

blueprint argparse-in-swift-ring-builder

Change-Id: I57080bb625e812f6cea71199df907a44b332b552

this is enough black magic I need tox experts in on it. If they agree I'm good for a +2."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-05-28 19:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

{posargs} just adds the positional arguments from the command line as arguments to the command.  I use it in my own tox setups, particularly my "shell" environments:

    [testenv:shell]
    deps = -r{toxinidir}/.requires
           -r{toxinidir}/.test-requires
           nose
    commands = {posargs}

Then, a "tox -e shell python" runs python in a virtual environment that has all my requires installed.  (I use this for figuring out obscure test failures or trying code by hand prior to crafting an actual unit test for it.)'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-05-28 21:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-05-28 21:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Add posargs support to flake8 call

Add posargs to flake8 call in tox.ini, with this you can pass arguments
directly into flake8 using the following notation
  tox -epep8 -- --FLAKE8-ARG

Change-Id: I1296eac3df46438ef050bf99ca33eb38d3b02efa

commit_message:
Enumerate Flake8 E12x ignores

Instead of ignoring all E12x errors, ignore only the failing ones,
so its easy to fix each one separately.

Change-Id: Id365f4d61be56b51823ead8c7c1948e034ea609b

commit_message:
Cell weighing class to handle mute child cells

Give negative weight to child cells that have not recently sent
capability or capacity updates to their parent cell.

Change-Id: I7cada3e1b6f04c48b71c82d8e0a8527e44674abd

the search already returns an empty list and some recipes

error out on nil

Change-Id: I2062ecf223a573fdfb7489a280a2bda776f5289a
'}]
commit_message:
return empty list for no results on both memcached_servers branches

the search already returns an empty list and some recipes
e.g. nova-common assume that the returned value will be a list and would
error out on nil

Change-Id: I2062ecf223a573fdfb7489a280a2bda776f5289a

"}, {'created': '2013-05-28 21:10:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix and enable flake8 F812
