commit_message:
Fix and enable flake8 F812

F812 list comprehension redefines

List comprehension don't have scope so redefining variables can lead to
unexpected behaviors

Change-Id: I85484dfcd4fa391195ea7be75aadc7897da4739c

commit_message:
Allow specifying a listen IP

Fixes: Bug #1183314

- Update api options in ceilometer/api
- Create 'api' option group
- Read options in bin/ceilometer-api
- Update sample config
- Updated tests

Change-Id: Ic76d95f262ac9b0675cf37698c9bcdf65aff9821

[{'created': '2013-05-28 13:39:58.000000000', 'message': "doc: fix hyphens instead of underscores for 'os*' configuration options

The ceilometer documentation, on the configuration page, list some options with hyphens (e.g. 'os-tenant-id') which are unknown options: underscores are required instead (e.g.: 'os_tenant_id').

Fixes: bug #1177002
Change-Id: Iea9c53f628df0b3bed06206e9b2241ed949131fa
"}, {'created': '2013-05-28 14:01:52.000000000', 'message': "doc: fix hyphens instead of underscores for 'os*' conf options

The ceilometer documentation, on the configuration page,
list some options with hyphens (e.g. 'os-tenant-id') which are unknown options:
underscores are required instead (e.g.: 'os_tenant_id').

Fixes: bug #1177002
Change-Id: Iea9c53f628df0b3bed06206e9b2241ed949131fa
"}]
commit_message:
doc: fix hyphens instead of underscores for 'os*' conf options

The ceilometer documentation, on the configuration page,
list some options with hyphens (e.g. 'os-tenant-id') which are unknown options:
underscores are required instead (e.g.: 'os_tenant_id').

Fixes: bug #1177002
Change-Id: Iea9c53f628df0b3bed06206e9b2241ed949131fa

[{'created': '2013-05-21 06:31:58.000000000', 'message': 'ImagePollster record duplicate counter during one poll

When using ImagePollster to poll image status from Glance, there might be
duplicate image status event recorded down if there are private images together
with public images stored in Glance.

In Glance, the get image list API looks like:
    def _get_images(self, context, filters, **params):
        ...
        # NOTE(markwash): for backwards compatibility, is_public=True for
        # admins actually means "treat me as if I'm not an admin and show me
        # all my images"
        if context.is_admin and params.get('is_public') is True:
            context.is_admin = False
            del params['is_public']
        ...
The above code shows that if a user is of 'admin_role'(this option is configured
in the glance-api.conf)  and querying for public images, Glance will return all
the public images together with the private ones.

While in ceilometer/image/glance.py#_Base.iter_images method, ceilometer get
the image list by querying public and private images respectively and then
chain the result lists together. This causes the duplication of image in the
image list.

This fix changes the code in ImagePollster.get_counters method to filter out
the duplicate images based on their image id.

Change-Id: Ib5e213161043033c20195efc0c6e7edd78982bd6
Fixes: Bug 1180630

commit_message:
ImagePollster record duplicate counter during one poll

When using ImagePollster to poll image status from Glance, there might
be duplicate image status event recorded down if there are private
images together with public images stored in Glance.

In Glance, the get image list API looks like:
    def _get_images(self, context, filters, **params):
        ...
 # NOTE(markwash): for backwards compatibility, is_public=True for
 # admins actually means "treat me as if I'm not an admin and show
 # all my images"
        if context.is_admin and params.get('is_public') is True:
            context.is_admin = False
            del params['is_public']
        ...
The above code shows that if a user is of 'admin_role'(this option is
configured in the glance-api.conf)  and querying for public images,
Glance will return all the public images together with the private
ones

While in ceilometer/image/glance.py#_Base.iter_images method,
ceilometer get the image list by querying public and private images
respectively and then chain the result lists together. This causes
the duplication of image in the image list.

This fix changes the code in ImagePollster.get_counters method to
filter out the duplicate images based on their image id.

Change-Id: Ib5e213161043033c20195efc0c6e7edd78982bd6
Fixes: Bug 1180630

commit_message:
libvirt unix_socket_group attribute

- libvirtd.conf template now suports unix_socket_group defined in
  a attribiutes.
- openstack-nova user shuld be member of libvirt group to be able to read
  from libvirt unix_socket. Implemented group resource in libvirt recipie.

Change-Id: I88370f2d7fd5147f3bb46a1411295868a8ea12ce

I note several import ordering issues introduced by this ("novaclient.tests" sorts before "novaclient.v1_1"), but I don't consider that a big deal for right now.  I have more of a problem with the test suite living inside the novaclient namespace; I don't like the idea of installing the whole test suite when we install novaclient.  That said, the convention for OpenStack projects in general is to do that, so I won't hold up over that, either.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-05-20 15:45:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

b) consumers of the library can find access to the test suite unexpectedly useful. I ran in to this with consuming pep8, actually

commit_message:
Move tests into the novaclient package.

tests/__init__.py implies a package in the global namespace. These
tests are not global python tests, but rather tests for novaclient.

Change-Id: Ifeb8082aa010d15dddc9ae02e35589bc78ad48cc

commit_message:
Add CONTRIBUTING file.

This adds a pointer to how to contribute. Also, github will show
this on the pull requests page, so having one of these is a friendly
way to let people know we don't use those.

Change-Id: I36829798adacb0f6b8144502baeff64ca84e32b6

commit_message:
Rename requires files to standard names.

The python community groks requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt as
reasonably standard files. We should use those filenames to make our
information more discoverable.

Fixes bug 1179008

Change-Id: I50a7c46f880e4257fa31d7d322d7bf70b0f5d3a6

commit_message:
fix a misleading docstring

GroupAntiAffinityFilter was introduced to filter a set of hosts,
howerver the docstring saying filter a set of instances which need to be
fixed.

Change-Id: Icf66a3ad15b4135c06e2e2ccc62837a346fcfdf7

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-05-16 00:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-05-19 22:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I wonder if we should move it to a more top-level location'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-05-20 17:49:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ian: I thought about that, but I thought it might be undesirable to configure RDO if it would not be required, and decided to only configure it if it was clear that openvswitch would need to be installed.  Were it to be configured at a higher level - say, in install_prereqs.sh - either RDO would have to always be enabled for RHEL6 (even if it wouldn't be used) or there would have to be logic extracted for reuse from the quantum setup that could determine whether RDO would be required.

Devstack cores - is the current approach acceptable, or would you like to see one of the alternatives I mentioned?"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-05-20 18:41:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

All of the RPMs pulled in here (rdo-release, openvswitch and dependencies) need to be in the appropriate files/rpms/* so they can be loaded in to the pre-built CI environment.  If you do not want them installed with the rest of the deps add '# NOPRIME' to the line so they are only downloaded and then installed by your patch."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-05-20 19:12:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-05-20 19:15:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dean: As requested, the latest patch adds openvswitch as an rpm dependency and moves the repo configuration to install_prereqs.sh so that the package will be available.  The only questionable thing about this patch is the definition of the RHEL6_RDO_REPO_* variables in stackrc - I didn't see any definitions in install_prereqs.sh and presumed what that implied.  Please let me know where those definitions would ideally go."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-20 20:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Ensure Open vSwitch can be installed on RHEL6.

 * RHEL6 does not include Open vSwitch in the default repos, but it
   is available via the RDO repo.  This patch automatically
   configures the RDO repo for RHEL6.
 * The openvswitch package is now listed as an rpm dependency to
   ensure it can be cached by a pre-built CI environment.

Change-Id: I8f93f53039cca4ff29bcb91720be7bb047b3ed8a

commit_message:
Test cases for Policy V3 API-New

Adds a test script "test_policy.py" so as to test all the policy
API actions. And policy_client.py is added with all the required
methods. Implementation done in JSON and XML interfaces.

Change-Id: I1f4de6f0d9b8bfd58da3fd14819f3173a3f5adba
Implements: blueprint keystone-v3-policy-api-test

adjust the index file to be more readable for the field guide

adjust titles to make more sense when displayed in top level index

change theme to 'nature', which is closer to the openstack default

Change-Id: I4f5fed65f9e26a4e4d333b1be4ed02c9ec246b9a

commit_message:
update docs for consistency

adjust the index file to be more readable for the field guide

adjust titles to make more sense when displayed in top level index

change theme to 'nature', which is closer to the openstack default
style. Will eventually write our own style here.

Change-Id: I4f5fed65f9e26a4e4d333b1be4ed02c9ec246b9a

commit_message:
Add log_dir and use by default instead of log_file

The log_file directive can end up forcing all agents (which are
called with --config-file /etc/quantum/quantum.conf) to log to the
/var/log/quantum/server.log file instead of their respective log
files. Instead, use log_dir = /var/log/quantum as the default while
still supporting log_file.

Change-Id: Ia6b29de80c8700f4ee27a4e0ba9af241021dc6b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-28 17:16:29.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly specify AZ for boot volume

If a volume is to be used as a boot volume (i.e. attached to the
Instance prior to creation using the Volumes property, rather than
afterwards with a VolumeAttachment), then it cannot obtain the
AvailabilityZone (which, if not specified, is assigned dynamically) from
the Instance, since that has not yet been created and assigned to an AZ.
Instead, require the AZ to be specified as a parameter.

Change-Id: Icccc9b531b1fd7754d76c13d90679ed04c9c0d02
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly specify AZ for boot volume

If a volume is to be used as a boot volume (i.e. attached to the
Instance prior to creation using the Volumes property, rather than
afterwards with a VolumeAttachment), then it cannot obtain the
AvailabilityZone (which, if not specified, is assigned dynamically) from
the Instance, since that has not yet been created and assigned to an AZ.
Instead, require the AZ to be specified as a parameter.

Change-Id: Icccc9b531b1fd7754d76c13d90679ed04c9c0d02

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-05-28 17:54:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

(2 inline comments)

Hi Alex,

I'm a bit nervous about this change to the store interface. I get the motivation. If we know the location before we start saving, then the api can enforce cleanup.

I've actually written custom stores before, however, where this wouldn't really work--for example I was encoding the length of the image in the location, because the backend I was using was very block-oriented and the length was necessary.

It's also possible to have a store that load balances among various endpoints, in which case the location returned for one attempt might not be the same as the location returned for the next with the same image uuid.

I just want a little more time to think about this possible change. Can you help me understand why the storage libraries aren't capable of cleaning up after themselves?"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-05-28 21:04:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

Hey Mark,

You bring up some really good points. I think your right and the storage backend should figure out what to do to cleanup on it's own, that makes perfect sense.

Do you think I should file some bugs for store code like swifts that doesn't cleanup leftover data on error? Also, do you think any of these concerns would apply to glance calling initiate_deletion when a checksum or size mismatch occurs?"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-05-28 21:08:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think it is better if we can figure out a way to clean up leftover data in the stores. But if we can't, this approach is valid we might just want to see if we can rework it a tiny bit.

Definitely file bugs for stores that don't clean up--those need to be fixed regardless."}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-05-28 21:13:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Abandoned

The stores should handle their own cleanup on failure if it's applicable."}]

commit_message:
Always cleanup image data on safe kill

This patch changes the following:
1) Add ability to get image location from the store (so we can clean it up)
2) On the event of error when uploading image data to store, clean up
the image data in the store if applicable

Fixes bug 1176177

Change-Id: I4cec97ec1f0a778508a25b23740ad04b42a075fd

commit_message:
ZeroMQ driver to default to redis matchmaker

Switching to the redis matchmaker.

The localhost matchmaker does not presently work.
Also, the localhost matchmaker could not work for
multi-host setups.

Change-Id: I81a26b9af78328e360a18b87371c619e194365d2

commit_message:
Create usable IPC directory for ZeroMQ

By default, the zeromq driver looks for
/var/run/openstack which needs to be created and
given the right permissions.

It is easier and just as safe in the case of devstack
to just use mktemp to establish a temporary working
directory.

Change-Id: I4cec33e49d2b042a244420fb40d83d476e4971cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-28 01:39:05.000000000', 'message': "Add h-api to suggested ENABLED_SERVICES for Heat

Currently lib/heat says:

    To enable, add the following to localrc
    ENABLED_SERVICES+=,heat,h-api-cfn,h-api-cw,h-eng

Once the stack is up, `heat list` fails because the API server
isn't running.

This commit adds h-api to that list.
Also make sure h-api is killed in stop_heat().

Change-Id: I2e818bb343680b3778f9277c23c766f784d28887
"}]
commit_message:
Add h-api to suggested ENABLED_SERVICES for Heat

Currently lib/heat says:

    To enable, add the following to localrc
    ENABLED_SERVICES+=,heat,h-api-cfn,h-api-cw,h-eng

Once the stack is up, `heat list` fails because the API server
isn't running.

This commit adds h-api to that list.
Also make sure h-api is killed in stop_heat().

Change-Id: I2e818bb343680b3778f9277c23c766f784d28887

[{'created': '2013-05-22 05:52:48.000000000', 'message': "Force-install nose via pip for RHEL.

 * It's not possible to prevent python-nose from being installed
   since so many os packages dependent on it, so this patch forces
   pip installation of nose after os package installation.

Change-Id: I756d1ca5eda127dcdd2efb047c8e14dd344f710d
"}, {'created': '2013-05-27 21:24:07.000000000', 'message': "Install nose 1.1 from EPEL for RHEL.

 * It's not possible to prevent python-nose (which is not compatible
 * with Tempest) from being installed since so many os packages
   dependent on it.  As a workaround, this patch installs
   python-nose1.1 from EPEL and adds a /usr/local/bin symlink for
   nosetests so that invocations for Tempest will work as expected.

Change-Id: I756d1ca5eda127dcdd2efb047c8e14dd344f710d
"}, {'created': '2013-05-27 21:27:12.000000000', 'message': "Install nose 1.1 from EPEL for RHEL.

 * It's not possible to prevent python-nose (which is not compatible
   with Tempest) from being installed since so many os packages
   dependent on it.
 * This patch installs python-nose1.1 from EPEL and adds a
   /usr/local/bin symlink for nosetests1.1 so that invocations for
   Tempest will work as expected.

Change-Id: I756d1ca5eda127dcdd2efb047c8e14dd344f710d
"}]
commit_message:
Install nose 1.1 from EPEL for RHEL.

 * It's not possible to prevent python-nose (which is not compatible
   with Tempest) from being installed since so many os packages
   dependent on it.
 * This patch installs python-nose1.1 from EPEL and adds a
   /usr/local/bin symlink for nosetests1.1 so that invocations for
   Tempest will work as expected.

Change-Id: I756d1ca5eda127dcdd2efb047c8e14dd344f710d

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-01-11 16:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

One nice enhancement would be the ability to split a batch of build requests down different cell paths.  For example, if a run_instance request was to build 50 instances and there 30 "units" free in child1 and 30 "units" free in child2, you can only service the request if you break it up.  

I wouldn't mess with this now, just something to think about after this maze of dependent patches lands. :)

Also, it'd be great to get some documentation, perhaps in cells/filters/__init__ just describing what the possible filter_responses are. "}, {'created': '2013-05-06 23:14:32.000000000', 'message': "Cells: Add filtering and weight support

This adds filtering and weighing support to the cells scheduler.

Adds the following config options to the 'cells' group:

scheduler_filter_classes -- list of filter classes
scheduler_weight_classes -- list of weight classes

Adds a couple of weighing modules as defaults (which removes the random
cell selection):

ram_by_instance_type: Select cells with the most capacity for the
instance type being requested.
weight_offset: Allows modifying the DB to weight a particular cell
(useful for disabling a cell)

Adds a filter class that allows specifying a scheduler hint to direct a
build to a particular cell.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I027c5734e3d6134127fcd4dd28b8ff39047416dc

DocImpact

Change-Id: I027c5734e3d6134127fcd4dd28b8ff39047416dc

commit_message:
Cells: Add filtering and weight support

This adds filtering and weighing support to the cells scheduler.

Adds the following config options to the 'cells' group:

scheduler_filter_classes -- list of filter classes
scheduler_weight_classes -- list of weight classes

Adds a couple of weighing modules as defaults (which removes the random
cell selection):

ram_by_instance_type: Select cells with the most capacity for the
instance type being requested.
weight_offset: Allows modifying the DB to weight a particular cell
(useful for disabling a cell)

Adds a filter class (TargetCellFilter) that allows specifying a scheduler
hint to direct a build to a particular cell if you're an admin.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint cells-filter-scheduler

Change-Id: I027c5734e3d6134127fcd4dd28b8ff39047416dc

There was a bug where a GlobalCheck would report the same error four times
instead of once. This stemmed from a place in the code where we were iterating
a tuple, and on each iteration, yielding the whole tuple.

commit_message:
Fix yield bug for GlobalCheck

There was a bug where a GlobalCheck would report the same error four times
instead of once. This stemmed from a place in the code where we were iterating
a tuple, and on each iteration, yielding the whole tuple.

The result was that the 4-tuple, when returned, would generate four error
messages.

The solution is to yield the tuple once.

Change-Id: I87de3beded4b3c981d353a1647247ee84bbfccd0
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/30480
Reviewed-by: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Approved: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
Reviewed-by: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
Tested-by: Jenkins

[{'created': '2013-05-14 16:59:11.000000000', 'message': "Check cached SSH connection in PowerVM driver

The PowerVM operator code caches an SSH connection to the hypervisor
which can become invalid if the connection to the hypervisor is not
terminated cleanly, e.g. the hypervisor is rebooted while the compute
node is connected to it.

This code checks an existing SSH connection object to see if it's
transport is still alive and if not, re-establishes the connection
before attempting to run SSH commands on the hypervisor.

Also added some basic unit tests to cover the new check_connection
function in nova.virt.powervm.common.

Fixes bug 1177104

Conflicts:

        nova/tests/test_powervm.py

Change-Id: I08079cf0d9e60e1d8902d32d684d979b06f7f287
(cherry picked from commit 75545ba974afb1ac76186a8dad359ae0aa751c01)
"}]
commit_message:
Check cached SSH connection in PowerVM driver

The PowerVM operator code caches an SSH connection to the hypervisor
which can become invalid if the connection to the hypervisor is not
terminated cleanly, e.g. the hypervisor is rebooted while the compute
node is connected to it.

This code checks an existing SSH connection object to see if it's
transport is still alive and if not, re-establishes the connection
before attempting to run SSH commands on the hypervisor.

Also added some basic unit tests to cover the new check_connection
function in nova.virt.powervm.common.

Fixes bug 1177104

Conflicts:

        nova/tests/test_powervm.py

Change-Id: I08079cf0d9e60e1d8902d32d684d979b06f7f287
(cherry picked from commit 75545ba974afb1ac76186a8dad359ae0aa751c01)

commit_message:
Capitalize boolean values in config files

This patch allows the usage of Puppet boolean values and still
configure values with OpenStack boolean style: True/False.

Change-Id: I5608655aa308833c2984e058f02a30b16fdab84c

commit_message:
Allow to hide config values from Puppet logs

Hide configuration value from Puppet logs if the secret parameter
is set to true.

Fixes: bug #1173322
Change-Id: I380a86b834c2f6cb6f347cade6137ee2e757f091

[{'created': '2013-05-28 19:00:03.000000000', 'message': 'Set $BASE before $GATE_SCRIPT_DIR.

* devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh: $BASE was used to construct $GATE_SCRIPT_DIR
but $BASE was set after $GATE_SCRIPT_DIR. Move the order of assignments
to fix this.

Change-Id: Ic6ee8f7f0a1db0c191e37fd3eec1d970752c8db0
'}]
commit_message:
Set $BASE before $GATE_SCRIPT_DIR.

* devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh: $BASE was used to construct $GATE_SCRIPT_DIR
but $BASE was set after $GATE_SCRIPT_DIR. Move the order of assignments
to fix this.

Change-Id: Ic6ee8f7f0a1db0c191e37fd3eec1d970752c8db0

Lorin,

We already have a guide with image creation chapter covering Ubuntu/centos/windows why not merge it with this?
     In current state it gets a feeling more of a centos based image creation guide.

What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-05-20 14:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think we need to continue to make the Admin manual smaller. This partially addresses bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1110137, which indicates "running OpenStack" books are exhaustive past the point of being useful.

This patch will let the separate guide build: https://review.openstack.org/29782'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-05-20 18:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Atul:

Ultimately, this guide should contain all of the info that's currently in the compute admin, minus all of the stuff that's gone out of date. I did want to get a first version of this committed and into the repo rather than do the whole thing as a big-bang.

I focused on centos because I could test most of the stuff directly, and because with Ubuntu there are official images so it's easier to download and roll your own. I didn't want to copy-paste too much existing content without verifying that it actually worked properly."}, {'account_id': 1177, 'date': '2013-05-20 19:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Lorin,

That image creation chapter was there from very initial days when csscorp guide got merged with the official one. AFAIK building an image is independent of OpenStack release.

What i will do is i will test image creation for other distribution and patch this submitted  doc. I think that will be a good option. :)'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-05-20 19:14:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

There were problems in the old content, such as:
 - using ami/aki/ari instead of raw/qcow2
 - using kpartx and nbd instead of libguestfs
 - hand-written scripts instead of cloud-init

So, they work, in the sense that you will get images that work with OpenStack, but there are now better ways.

I'd really like to get this in so we can make changes piecemeal to it. We could hold off on generating the html/pdf if necessary."}, {'account_id': 1177, 'date': '2013-05-20 19:22:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Lorin,

There were problems in the old content, such as:
 - using ami/aki/ari instead of raw/qcow2
 - using kpartx and nbd instead of libguestfs
 - hand-written scripts instead of cloud-init

If you think these are the new/better ways of building image it would be really nice to have bundling .deb based distro covered  too. This will help everyone else who wants to bundle there own .deb based image bundle.'}, {'account_id': 1177, 'date': '2013-05-20 19:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Just had quick chat with Lorin once he adds the image building steps for .deb based distro we are ready to go.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-05-21 14:30:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I don't mind getting this in and working on it. The build can also build, but we don't have to create a link from one of the index.html pages. Would that work?"}, {'account_id': 1177, 'date': '2013-05-22 07:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Anne,
Lorin has done all the hard work and it will take some time to document the missing bit. It will be better to merge complete furnished guide. That was my suggestion. Rest is on you folks to decide.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-05-23 19:25:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add a 'netaddress' value type for --key.

It is quite common to expect either a numeric IP address or domain name.
We include all ASCII characters needed to express IPv4, CIDR networks,
IPv6, or DNS names.

Change-Id: I2ab370d2bdad0d568b34c4ed55d60a5b6cdd9b19

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-28 17:58:59.000000000', 'message': 'dbsync is not using database_connection in configuration file

ceilometer-dbsync is currently ignoring database_connection
parameter in the configuration file. Instead it uses sql_connection
parameter (which is a correct behavior), however, sql_connection
is not a valid ceilometer configuration parameter. In the future,
ceilometer probably should consider use sql_connection instead of
using database_connection. OpenStack common session code assumes
database engine is created based on sql_connection in the config
file, not database_connection.

Change-Id: I4e0060ed7c7a70c9b07016e4c2f123039aaaa2a4
fixes: bug #1183106
'}]
commit_message:
dbsync is not using database_connection in configuration file

ceilometer-dbsync is currently ignoring database_connection
parameter in the configuration file. Instead it uses sql_connection
parameter (which is a correct behavior), however, sql_connection
is not a valid ceilometer configuration parameter. In the future,
ceilometer probably should consider use sql_connection instead of
using database_connection. OpenStack common session code assumes
database engine is created based on sql_connection in the config
file, not database_connection.

Change-Id: I4e0060ed7c7a70c9b07016e4c2f123039aaaa2a4
fixes: bug #1183106

subject: Improve test stability
messages:
[{'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2013-05-28 10:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

This is an interesting case. We use pytz.common_timezones. For some reason, Canada/Newfoundland is not included in the common_timezones. It is nice to know which pytz generates this error, as in the latest pytz Canada/Newfoundland is actually present in the list of common timezones. What about preserving the timezone in the test, while setting a minimal version number in the pip-requires file? commit_message:
Improve test stability

Under some circumstances, Canada/Newfoundland (UTC -03:30)
can not be found as answer in tests. This patch improves
stability here by using cities with the same distances to
UTC and UTC DST.

Fixes bug 1184901

Change-Id: I7d5739a7c7a504c22cceebeaa3331637993e34ae

commit_message:
Group CRUD and Management in Admin Dashboard.

Add support for CRUD on Group for admin users. It also includes
the user management capability for the group.

Keystone revokes the token when a user is added or removed from the
group. If the logon user is added/removed from the group, the user
will be redirected to the login page.

This feature is only exposed if the user explicitly set horizon
for keystone V3.

Implements blueprint admin-group-crud

Change-Id: I1b5456af80bcc35e9d16ac6ba6792e82704e76fd

Generate the DnsSecKey inside the broker.

This means that the broker also hosts the bind server.

Change-Id: I29e79a64868ce5f4e7a3ab4dae45d7e361375ac1

[{'created': '2013-05-28 04:58:31.000000000', 'message': "OpenShift.template fixes

This includes the following changes:
- requests from outside the broker were not reaching it without
  setting configure_firewall => true
- puppet module install was failing due to missing /etc/puppet/modules
- on the node puppet --apply was failing because the openshift_origin
  module wasn't installed
Change-Id: Ie6f1f0f6e2bdbde1521ffdd285041c87f3933e42
"}]
commit_message:
OpenShift.template fixes

This includes the following changes:
- requests from outside the broker were not reaching it without
  setting configure_firewall => true
- puppet module install was failing due to missing /etc/puppet/modules
- on the node puppet --apply was failing because the openshift_origin
  module wasn't installed
Change-Id: Ie6f1f0f6e2bdbde1521ffdd285041c87f3933e42

commit_message:
Create resources in parallel where possible

Use the create co-routines with a DependencyTaskGroup to create resources
in parallel where possible, subject to their dependencies.

This implements blueprint concurrent-resource-scheduling with the exception
of nested stacks.

Change-Id: I4789ab11617b408622d8fc083e6b80a797d99e3a

[{'created': '2013-05-28 08:21:28.000000000', 'message': 'Move deletion from dependency graph to __delitem__

Graph objects are mutable, and will in future be used for operations other
than a topological sort, so abstract out the code for deleting backlinks to
a node from the other nodes that have dependencies on it when it is
removed.

Change-Id: I86b81303ed2dffd969a2db10535761f108f4808a
'}]
commit_message:
Move deletion from dependency graph to __delitem__

Graph objects are mutable, and will in future be used for operations other
than a topological sort, so abstract out the code for deleting backlinks to
a node from the other nodes that have dependencies on it when it is
removed.

Change-Id: I86b81303ed2dffd969a2db10535761f108f4808a

commit_message:
Make the mutable dependency graph a separate class

Rather than copying dictionaries internally, provide a separate Graph class
that can be copied externally as well.

Change-Id: Id0bd55944369da59d7da1713369fce0d73ffe814

commit_message:
Make dependency graph node class public

We're going to start making more use of it, so there's no point hiding it
away inside the Dependencies class.

Change-Id: I10c4a05493697f8834623cd798ef35161a0c219b

(3 inline comments)

Now that I've seen this in action in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29978/ (plus it's changed a little bit from the earlier version) I have a few ideas for making a cleaner API:

* Use the same mechanism for all three hook points (instead of 2 being functions and one a variable as it is now).  I think they should all be functions.
* Don't also define variables to tell you if the functions exist, instead just check to see if they do: stackoverflow.com/questions/85880/determine-if-a-function-exists-in-bash
* Add a short section to the README that describes how to use this (esp since we're about to lose the top-of-file documentation when the variables go away).
* (minor) Maybe change the hook names so they don't include 'devstack' to indicate this is more general purpose?  "run_pre_test_hook" perhaps?  That should make it a little less weird for callers who aren't intending to run devstack at all.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-05-24 17:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-05-24 17:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-09 23:28:00.000000000', 'message': "Add support for configurable pre and post hooks.

In order for a non-gating project to make a job that uses the devstack
gating infrastructure as written to run additional things in or on the
devstack instance, it's useful to be able to run a pre-hook to execute
commands after repos are pulled but before devstack is run, and to run
a post-hook before cleanup so that additional tests can be run.

Change-Id: I9d2435780a23a04a8b34b2d885125132a7e4f16a
"}, {'created': '2013-03-10 04:08:01.000000000', 'message': "Add support for configurable pre and post hooks.

commit_message:
Add support for configurable pre and post hooks.

Adds 3 hooks to the devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh script so that we can
make use of this script for non-devstack type gating tests.

The new hooks are:
 -pre_test_hook (optional, only executed if defined)
 -gate_hook (runs the devstack-vm-gate.sh as a default)
 -post_test_hook (optional, only executed if defined)

Change-Id: I9d2435780a23a04a8b34b2d885125132a7e4f16a

commit_message:
Add support for Sphinx Docs.

Also turn on doc API autoindexing.

This depends on https://review.openstack.org/30520 landing in pbr and a
new point release being cut, as it uncovered a bug.

Change-Id: I8f4ffc4f7c54c7b207d6d52e74ccab020596e602

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-22 04:45:20.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize SecurityGroupsOutputController by len(servers)

The following patch adds an optimization for _extend_servers() so that
it calls get_instance_security_groups() when len(servers) == 1, and
get_instances_security_groups_bindings() when > 1. In addition, this patch
adds a return statement if not len(servers) as there is no reason to
perform a query if there are no servers. Note: no unit tests are added
for this patch as existing tests already provide code coverage.

Fixes bug 1182730

Change-Id: I149bf32176d60e72d76576168d15995f7215b657
'}, {'created': '2013-05-22 05:39:55.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize SecurityGroupsOutputController by len(servers)

The following patch adds an optimization for _extend_servers() so that
it calls get_instance_security_groups() when len(servers) == 1, and
get_instances_security_groups_bindings() when > 1. In addition, this patch
adds a return statement if not len(servers) as there is no reason to
perform a query if there are no servers.

Fixes bug 1182730

Change-Id: I149bf32176d60e72d76576168d15995f7215b657
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize SecurityGroupsOutputController by len(servers)

The following patch adds an optimization for _extend_servers() so that
it calls get_instance_security_groups() when len(servers) == 1, and
get_instances_security_groups_bindings() when > 1. In addition, this patch
adds a return statement if not len(servers) as there is no reason to
perform a query if there are no servers.

Fixes bug 1182730

Change-Id: I149bf32176d60e72d76576168d15995f7215b657

commit_message:
Fix doc autoindexing.

The config section get returns a tuple, not a string, so we were trying
to lower() a tuple. That clearly does not work.

Change-Id: I96602a25686d447bd3437807d9e55aaec6bb9540
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/30520
Reviewed-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Reviewed-by: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>
Reviewed-by: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Reviewed-by: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>
Approved: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-09 14:50:18.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: make the xenapi agent optional per image

part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop

Change-Id: Ie51a9f54e5b2e85fe4ebebb0aff975db296ba996
'}, {'created': '2013-05-10 12:04:25.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: make the xenapi agent optional per image

part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop

Change-Id: Ie51a9f54e5b2e85fe4ebebb0aff975db296ba996
'}, {'created': '2013-05-10 15:17:53.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: make the xenapi agent optional per image

DocImpact
part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop

This adds the ability to decide, per image, if xenapi should use
the agent for servers created from that image.

It uses the image properties that are copied into system metadata
to detect if "agent_enabled"=True on the image the server was
created from. If the tag is not present, it defaults to the value
of the new conf setting "xenapi_agent_enabled_default".

This opens up the path to using config drive or the metadata
service with cloud-init to perform tasks like file injection

Change-Id: Ie51a9f54e5b2e85fe4ebebb0aff975db296ba996
'}, {'created': '2013-05-10 15:17:53.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: make the xenapi agent optional per image

DocImpact
part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop

This adds the ability to decide, per image, if xenapi should use
the agent for servers created from that image.

It uses the image properties that are copied into system metadata
to detect if "agent_enabled"=True on the image the server was
created from. If the tag is not present, it defaults to the value
of the new conf setting "xenapi_agent_enabled_default".

This opens up the path to using config drive or the metadata
service with cloud-init to perform tasks like file injection

Change-Id: Ie51a9f54e5b2e85fe4ebebb0aff975db296ba996
'}, {'created': '2013-05-10 16:56:26.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: make the xenapi agent optional per image

DocImpact
part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop

This adds the ability to decide, per image, if xenapi should use
the agent for servers created from that image.

It uses the image properties that are copied into system metadata
to detect if "agent_enabled"=True on the image the server was
created from. If the tag is not present, it defaults to the value
of the new conf setting "xenapi_agent_enabled_default".

This opens up the path to using config drive or the metadata
service with cloud-init to perform tasks like file injection

Change-Id: Ie51a9f54e5b2e85fe4ebebb0aff975db296ba996
'}, {'created': '2013-05-13 09:32:50.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: make the xenapi agent optional per image

DocImpact
part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop

This adds the ability to decide, per image, if xenapi should use
the agent for servers created from that image.

It uses the image properties that are copied into system metadata
to detect if "agent_enabled"=True on the image the server was
created from. If the tag is not present, it defaults to the value
of the new conf setting "xenapi_agent_enabled_default".

Becuase that above settings defaults to False, it effectivly
means that, by default, xenapi driver no longer always waits for
the agent by default. This is why this change also fixes
bug 1178223

commit_message:
xenapi: make the xenapi agent optional per image

This adds the ability to decide, per image, if xenapi should use
the agent for servers created from that image.
This opens up the path to using config drive or the metadata
service with cloud-init to perform tasks like file injection

It uses the image properties that are copied into system metadata
to detect if "xenapi_agent_present"="true" on the image the server
was created from.
If the tag is not present, it defaults to the value
of the new conf setting "xenapi_agent_present_default".

Becuase the above setting defaults to False, it means that
the xenapi driver no longer waits for the agent by default.

DocImpact
fixes bug 1178223
part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop
Change-Id: Ie51a9f54e5b2e85fe4ebebb0aff975db296ba996

commit_message:
Made tests use a JSON parser in liue of eval.

The results that are being parsed are really JSON, so using a JSON parser is
more semantically correct; in addition using eval anywhere can set a bad
example.

Change-Id: Idcd55400b2571aba0f2f377cf66a3cbf4d3af960

commit_message:
Check Expiry

Explicitly checks the expiry on the tokens, and rejects tokens that
have expired

had to regenerate the sample data for the tokens as they all had been
generated with values that are now expired.

bug 1179615

Change-Id: Ie06500d446f55fd0ad67ea540c92d8cfc57483f4

commit_message:
reindent for consistency

reindent the javascript and html for consistency based on emacs
multi-mode.

Feel free to ignore if this isn't desired, it just causes me mental
pain to work with html files that aren't indented consistently.

Change-Id: Ia6043668777ebdafb882a946b51984791e1af658

was corrected.

commit_message:
Pull binary name from sys.argv[0]

Instead of inspecting the top of the stack to find the binary name, just
use sys.argv[0].  This is little cleaner then inspecting the stack.

Co-authored-by: Mark McClain <mark.mcclain@dreamhost.com>

Change-Id: I18d5233b6b0bd0ccaeeab5b7ce5006adcf4a8d40

commit_message:
Rename requires files to standard names.

    Rename tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt and tools/test-requires
    to test-requirements.txt. These are standard files, and tools in the
    general world are growing intelligence about them.

Change-Id: If5c7080fea7c5ca5935b3c064e368cb837a9c16b
Fixes: bug #1179008

dolphm:

This patch doesn't change the fact that paste configs *can* be edited. It just makes it so that those configs are isolated, which in practice turns out to be really useful for things like packages and config management.

We've pretty much got buy in for this approach in Nova, Glance, Cinder, Quantum, so I'd really like to see keystone separate paste configs out from the normal config file as well."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-04-04 21:28:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-11 23:46:51.000000000', 'message': 'separate paste-deploy configuration from parameters

paste-deploy configuration contains code paths, mixing it with
configuration parameters requires merging conf files on updates.
paste-deploy configuration is not normally user-editable, so keeping it
separate from user-configurable parameters allows deployers to move
paste-deploy ini file out of configuration directory to a place where
it can be safely overwritten on updates e.g. under /usr/share/

Change-Id: I9292ca6226c8430b93565dedd45cc842742a23e2

between releases. Keeping it separate from user-configurable parameters
allows deployers to move paste-deploy ini file out of configuration directory
to a place where it can be safely overwritten on updates e.g. under /usr/share/

to a place where it can be safely overwritten on updates e.g. under /usr/share/

Changes since last patch set:
- error handling when specified paste-ini is missing
- httpd support
- documentation update

DocImpact

commit_message:
separate paste-deploy configuration from parameters

PasteDeploy configuration contains class names which might change
between releases. Keeping it separate from user-configurable
parameters allows deployers to move paste-deploy ini file out of
configuration directory to a place where it can be safely overwritten
on updates e.g. under /usr/share/

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9292ca6226c8430b93565dedd45cc842742a23e2

commit_message:
Enumerate Flake8 Fxxx ignores

Instead of ignoring all Fxxx errors, ignore only the failing ones, so
its easy to fix each one separately.

Change-Id: I4ccc1d38247fb76b6dad4388b76c6e8d696f081f

commit_message:
Delete a quota through admin api.

Added 'extended-quotas' extension that has provides ability for admins
to be able to delete a non-default quota (absolute limit) for a tenant,
so that tenant's quota will revert back to the configured default.

Implements blueprint admin-api-for-delete-quota
Change-Id: I7375420a466823b3e099aebff71a8f7d7f922afb

commit_message:
Import oslo.config configuration file generator

This is stolen from Nova with a fix stolen from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30251/

Obviously the final goal is to stop copying this file into each project and
start improving it, to move it finally in oslo.config.

Change-Id: Ie81a5c3db1dc6092bcc6179ab0ab9499239f0bbc
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Changed processing unique constraint name.

Function `_raise_if_duplicate_entry_error()` modified respectively to
new unique constraint name convention.

We found that current constraint name convention allows us create
constraints with duplicate names. It happens if we will add constraints
in different tables with same column names (for example, `name`,
`deleted`). In this case we can not create new constraint due to mysql
limitation (it requires unique constraint name for database)
To solve this issue unique constraint name convention was changed
from "uniq_c1_x_c2_x_c3" to "uniq_t$c1$c2$c3" where `t` it is table name
and columns `c1`, `c2`, `c3` are in UniqueConstraint.

Function `_raise_if_duplicate_entry_error()` parse error from
database and provides us correct column names in error message.
So now we receive correct error message from function.

Change-Id: I4a507deba97c499fcd9738d980e36ca0f9454b71
Fixes: bug 1182054

commit_message:
Log configuration values on API startup

It's very helpful for every service to log its configuration values on
startup, so you can e.g. check typos.

Also, change the print statements in the API binary to info logs.

Change-Id: I1b4181ddc7f36149cddb2c24f514d526c403b2e0

commit_message:
Add metering-api endpoint registration

Add calls to identity_registration to support the Ceilometer metering
service. Ideally this does not live here long-term, in favor of the
metering cookbook, but until that cookbook is ready, this is being
placed here as a stop-gap measure.

Tests added for these new endpoints. Tests pass.

Change-Id: I13cfdc0fb2f280837fb4bc06dd0e6d46f059081a

commit_message:
Added image registration tests

Added registration tests to simply test the args being passed
to the `openstack_identity_register` LWRP.  The identity LWRP
should be tested at a deeper level than the consumers.

Testing args passed to a DSL (&block) is a bit tricky.  The tests
are not ideal, but give us the necessary coverage to catch common
errors.

Change-Id: I41c5f609582f8ceb46ea73788a0a37d557532444

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-28 04:31:04.000000000', 'message': 'Using ~> versioning

Since we should be performing semver across our cookbooks, we should
lock to the patch version.  It means "equal to or greater than in the
last digit", so e.g. "~> 2.3" means "equal to 2.3 or greater than 2.3,
but less than 3.0", while "~> 2.3.0" would mean "equal to 2.3.0 or greater
than 2.3.0, but less than 2.4.0".
  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5170547/what-does-tilde-greater-than-mean-in-ruby-gem-dependencies

Change-Id: I53b334865909868dcc9b5d003795adead1ecf86c
'}]
commit_message:
Using ~> versioning

Since we should be performing semver across our cookbooks, we should
lock to the patch version.  It means "equal to or greater than in the
last digit", so e.g. "~> 2.3" means "equal to 2.3 or greater than 2.3,
but less than 3.0", while "~> 2.3.0" would mean "equal to 2.3.0 or greater
than 2.3.0, but less than 2.4.0".
  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5170547/what-does-tilde-greater-than-mean-in-ruby-gem-dependencies

Change-Id: I53b334865909868dcc9b5d003795adead1ecf86c

commit_message:
Using ~> versioning

Since we should be performing semver across our cookbooks, we should
lock to the patch version.  It means "equal to or greater than in the
last digit", so e.g. "~> 2.3" means "equal to 2.3 or greater than 2.3,
but less than 3.0", while "~> 2.3.0" would mean "equal to 2.3.0 or greater
than 2.3.0, but less than 2.4.0".
  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5170547/what-does-tilde-greater-than-mean-in-ruby-gem-dependencies

Change-Id: Ifa0c45fa86860cc087ccc82b2a13f51f65ba1ea4

commit_message:
Using ~> versioning

Since we should be performing semver across our cookbooks, we should
lock to the patch version.  It means "equal to or greater than in the
last digit", so e.g. "~> 2.3" means "equal to 2.3 or greater than 2.3,
but less than 3.0", while "~> 2.3.0" would mean "equal to 2.3.0 or greater
than 2.3.0, but less than 2.4.0".
  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5170547/what-does-tilde-greater-than-mean-in-ruby-gem-dependencies

Change-Id: I17593a32c37270cc30e0afeecf0045177ad96df6

[{'created': '2013-05-28 10:33:06.000000000', 'message': "Don't use pecan to configure logging

Fixes bug #1184941

openstack.common.log gives a mechanism to configure logging and, by
default, we will set up a handler on root logger. Using pecan to also
configure a handler on the 'ironic' logger means every log message gets
logged to console twice.

It seems that the pecan logging configuration stuff is redundant with
our existing logging configuration infrastructure.

Change-Id: Iec0630b0e842e3b6a90021bf552d9b857c5a0552

openstack.common.log gives a mechanism to configure logging and, by
default, we will set up a handler on root logger. Using pecan to also
configure a handler on the 'ironic' logger means every log message gets

Change-Id: Iec0630b0e842e3b6a90021bf552d9b857c5a0552
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use pecan to configure logging

Fixes bug #1184941

openstack.common.log gives a mechanism to configure logging and, by
default, we will set up a handler on root logger. Using pecan to also
configure a handler on the 'ironic' logger means every log message gets
logged to console twice.

It seems that the pecan logging configuration stuff is redundant with
our existing logging configuration infrastructure.

Change-Id: Iec0630b0e842e3b6a90021bf552d9b857c5a0552

commit_message:
Use heat-engine.conf for heat-manage config

Fixes bug 1184923

because prog was missing the CONF object was looking for
the config file in /etc/heat/heat.conf  this should have
been /etc/heat/heat-engine.conf

Change-Id: Ie23b9998df368274d69180e0d619b042dd9dc053

subject: Extract V3 tests into a module.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-10 07:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/28770/1/check/gate-keystone-pep8/4992 : SUCCESS in 00:01:12
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/28770/1/check/gate-keystone-docs/3366/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 00:01:55
- http://logs.openstack.org/28770/1/check/gate-keystone-python26/3886 : SUCCESS in 00:07:44
- http://logs.openstack.org/28770/1/check/gate-keystone-python27/3898 : SUCCESS in 00:05:22
- http://logs.openstack.org/28770/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/15363 : SUCCESS in 00:44:40
- http://logs.openstack.org/28770/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/15079 : FAILURE in 00:45:31 (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/28770/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/21647 : SUCCESS in 00:20:36
- http://logs.openstack.org/28770/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/3094 : FAILURE in 00:09:53 (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-05-10 13:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

During the Grizzly cycle, we tried to make the test directory a module - and this broken many people's ability to run tests individually (e.g. "./run_tests.sy test_name").  We don't entirely understand why - different people experienced different levels of problem.  In the end we had to regress the change - it just broke too many people's ability to run individual tests.  I'm concerned that this will do the same.'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-05-11 01:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I assume that you are referring to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20131/ 

I see this to be a different problem. To my mind most of the concern with the above review was moving it into the main keystone package and how that would affect packaging and the existing scripts. 

This should not have the same effect.

Because nose still discovers the tests the only functionality difference of these test is if you reference the file by name you would for example do ./run_tests v3.test_auth rather that ./run_tests test_v3_auth. I am interested to know if it breaks any usages.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-05-28 10:44:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Jamie (sorry for the delay in response, I missed your comment).

The actual problem was encountered by the very act of making the test directory (wherever that may be or be called) a package by adding the __init__.py file.  That simple act broke a bunch of us...some more, some less.  After a couple of weeks of pain, we call gave up and regressed the change!  So you proposed change would also break us, I fear.  We don't really understand why it worked OK for some, partially for others and not at all for a further group of people.  We were all on the same version of nose.  We believe (although did not prove conclusively) that tox works OK in this situation.  As I think we are moving to tox, maybe the thing to do is re-apply this change once we have done this and a few of us can test it out?"}]

commit_message:
Add invalid number checking in flavor creation api

Flavor creation api doesn't check whether 'memory_mb'
argument number is integer,add invalid number checking
into the flavor creation function to remind the user to
input right value

Fixes bug #1171278

Change-Id: I0e8b2d7c24d845d8791e4c3ab3f11653fcea7c22

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-28 07:16:00.000000000', 'message': 'Use default cidr to avoid exception when editing quantum security rules.

$ quantum security-group-rule-create --direction ingress --protocol TCP
--port-range-min 80 --port-range-max 80 web

After creating security group rule with command above, An exception is thrown
when editing the rules for groups web.

Fixes: bug #1165095

Change-Id: If32992622ebc20559dde911455b241937eb59ae6
'}]
commit_message:
Use default cidr to avoid exception when editing quantum security rules.

$ quantum security-group-rule-create --direction ingress --protocol TCP
--port-range-min 80 --port-range-max 80 web

After creating security group rule with command above, An exception is thrown
when editing the rules for groups web.

Fixes: bug #1165095

Change-Id: If32992622ebc20559dde911455b241937eb59ae6

Christopher, what is the other approach?  also when is the tempest meeting?'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-18 03:36:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joe - Wednesdays 1700 UTC 

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings#QA_team_meeting

The main reason I bring this up is that when I did the original testtools compatibility work I moved the initialisation into the setupClass and then they got moved out again because of concerns around overhead. 

I don't have any strong feelings about it either way, but I don't think we should keep flipping back and forth :-)

It does seem rather suboptimal that in order to just do syntax checking that hacking essentially has to execute the code, but I guess we have to work with the tools we have..."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-05-18 09:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The meeting is Thursday.'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-18 11:53:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oops sorry about that. Don't know where I got Wednesday from. I don't attend them because its 2:30am localtime for me."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-19 05:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-05-20 05:56:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

While, I understand the logic behind arguing that the issue is in hacking.  This brings up a bigger question of, should modules be importable on there own without stacktracing?  If we decide that they don't have to be we can adjust hacking accordingly.

afazekas, thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-20 12:45:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I really do think we should be able to import modules without them stack tracing. I guess I'm not clear why the boto tests need to do so much magic on initialization."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-20 12:49:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

attila, this doesn't seem to actually increase run time in any substantial way. Where is the concern?"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-20 12:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-20 12:49:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Do you know what is the purpose of the module import rules ?
1. Prevent relative import style what almost nobody even know it is exists, and who know just use it when it is really necessary.
2. Prevent a relative import what will not be compatible with python 3.x. anyway.
3. Make possible the module reload, without keeping reference to the old one, what I have doubts is anyone using it with tempest.

AFAIK We don't have 1. 2. type of issue.
I got lot of negative feedback when I tried to apply 3.
Would be a good topic on the next meeting do we want to implement the modules import rule.
The reload capability sounds good, but not everyone likes
the module only import style. 

Now, I cannot use the flake8 checker on a code which I do not trust. Cannot be my default checker.

Using classes when it is not necessary it is a very bad practice IMHO. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o9pEzgHorH0
Python's real power not in the classes.

With unittest we have a limited options for external configure ability, and even now we do not have enough config/selection option for every thing. 

stress test actually is a regular python program.
In real program you have good options to avoid this kind of issues.

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main(sys.argv)

The main() should responsible for exception, this way can be acceptable by the flake8 checker too."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-20 12:49:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

getting more timing data'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-20 13:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Make tempest modules importable without throwing eror

When importing some tempest modules, they will raise an exception if a
config file isn't present.  Besides being a bad practice, hacking will
try importing modules, causing stacktraces during the pep8/syntax
checking steps.

To fix this, move code into __init__ functions.

Change-Id: I77d956daee27135c337551157d6ade7bdefd65f4

commit_message:
Wrong status code after deleting of a volume.

Response status code after successful deleting of
volume changed from 202 to 204, because response
body is empty.

Fixes LP bug #1174820

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icfb8fb8e360be055558b96cea721774816bf0bb0

commit_message:
Add support for entrypoints virt drivers.

Manage them via entry point loading. If the driver cannot be found via
entrypoint, then fall back to old-style import mechanism in case someone
else was relying on the old behavior.

With this, things like "pip install nova-virt-hyper-v" could be expected
to work.

Resurrected from: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11027
Uses short names from: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15030/1/setup.py

The new shorter names for the libvirt drivers are shown in setup.cfg. A
'deprecated' log will be shown if one tries to load a driver using its
classname or full class path.

When loading deprecated classes, we only care about the class name, not
the path to it. This means that a single line in setup.cfg can handle up
to 3 possible old settings.

Part of blueprint entrypoints-plugins
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia20ab01e2a9806b42acdfe040d678fce4b726c45

the broken cloud-init. We recently changed the default instance user for

Change-Id: Ieed885657169abaf9d382062ac5080cc3fc16d2f

commit_message:
Add support for default user of heat-admin.

As long as we are spinning up Ubuntu 12.10 we need this workaround for
the broken cloud-init. We recently changed the default instance user for
our own Heat deployments from 'ec2-user' to 'heat-admin'.

Change-Id: Ieed885657169abaf9d382062ac5080cc3fc16d2f

[{'created': '2013-05-28 02:06:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix the handling of non-existing paste file

First only call find_file() by it's self so we can check for None
(abspath crashes if you pass it None)
We are already calling abspath at the return, so this
also prevents a double call to abspath.

If return None from _get_deployment_config_file() load_paste_app() will
print out a nice error message.

Change-Id: I451e090b7f08266ca824b5da228dafde55726d94
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the handling of non-existing paste file

First only call find_file() by it's self so we can check for None
(abspath crashes if you pass it None)
We are already calling abspath at the return, so this
also prevents a double call to abspath.

If return None from _get_deployment_config_file() load_paste_app() will
print out a nice error message.

Change-Id: I451e090b7f08266ca824b5da228dafde55726d94

dan: I apologize for being so slow to respond. 

What you're coming up against is a It's a chicken-or-egg problem inherent to the xs/xcp support in devstack.  XenAPI plugins are installed in dom0 separate from the domU creation and there is no guarantee that git will be installed in dom0.  The workaround is to pull zipballs from github, but as you've noticed this presupposes that the xenapi plugins have already been merged.

The workaround is the devstack variable QUANTUM_ZIPBALL_URL.  Zip up the working tree of this change, post it to a local webserver, and provide the url via that devstack variable and the install should proceed.

The ideal solution would be for gerrit to support zipballs - I'll check with monty to see if this would be possible if only for the nova and quantum repos."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-28 03:44:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-28 03:44:30.000000000', 'message': "Add support for OVS l2 agent in XS/XCP domU.

 * Config doc: http://wiki.openstack.org/QuantumDevstackOvsXcp

 * The Open vSwitch agent needs to be deployed on domU but
   interact with a dom0 bridge.
 * Add a root wrapper and associated XenAPI plugin to allow the
   agent to execute networking commands against dom0 from domU.
 * Update ovs_lib mac address discovery to use ip_lib to
   ensure that discovery works even for bridges not local to
   the agent (i.e. dom0 bridges).  A bridge configured with
   a dom0 root wrapper will execute ip link on dom0.
 * Update ip_lib to use a root helper by default to ensure that
   the 'ip' command will execute on dom0.
 * Remove obselete rpm spec and installer for dom0 agent.
 * Credit where credit is due - the XenAPI plugin and its
   packaging were largely copied from nova.
 * Supports blueprint xenapi-ovs

Change-Id: I7795446ee1267712c896f5cb3401f84fb1763ce7

commit_message:
Add support for OVS l2 agent in XS/XCP domU.

 * Config doc: http://wiki.openstack.org/QuantumDevstackOvsXcp

 * The Open vSwitch agent needs to be deployed on domU but
   interact with a dom0 bridge.
 * Add a root wrapper and associated XenAPI plugin to allow the
   agent to execute networking commands against dom0 from domU.
 * Update ovs_lib mac address discovery to use ip_lib to
   ensure that discovery works even for bridges not local to
   the agent (i.e. dom0 bridges).  A bridge configured with
   a dom0 root wrapper will execute ip link on dom0.
 * Update ip_lib to use a root helper by default to ensure that
   the 'ip' command will execute on dom0.
 * Remove obselete rpm spec and installer for dom0 agent.
 * Credit where credit is due - the XenAPI plugin and its
   packaging were largely copied from nova.
 * Supports blueprint xenapi-ovs

Change-Id: I7795446ee1267712c896f5cb3401f84fb1763ce7

Good call, this could be a ProxyCheck in nova.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-05-28 02:54:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-24 19:34:58.000000000', 'message': "Add virt-driver prefix check

We have a style requirement in Nova that if a change only affects a specific
virt-driver,  the commit title should be prefixed with the driver-name, a
colon, and a space.

This patch adds a check to detect trivial cases where the only files that
changed were under a directories related to a given virt-driver. This check
shouldn't generate any false positives but could miss out on changes that have
small changes in non virt-specific files. Over time we can refine the check to
eliminate more and more these false negatives.

Change-Id: Ib67b3bf3fa47c756964c574213c13c5f92b75965
"}]
commit_message:
Add virt-driver prefix check

We have a style requirement in Nova that if a change only affects a specific
virt-driver,  the commit title should be prefixed with the driver-name, a
colon, and a space.

This patch adds a check to detect trivial cases where the only files that
changed were under a directories related to a given virt-driver. This check
shouldn't generate any false positives but could miss out on changes that have
small changes in non virt-specific files. Over time we can refine the check to
eliminate more and more these false negatives.

Change-Id: Ib67b3bf3fa47c756964c574213c13c5f92b75965

commit_message:
refactor test_engine_service.py

refactor tests based on stackServiceTestBase to be more like
the other tests, ie clear mocking, validation, and just
inherit from HeatTestCase rather than inheriting lots of
stuff from a base class, which isn't needed for all the tests

Fixes bug #1180375

Change-Id: I78ade1c53113f8f72b4df8ff346c45ec93f19393

commit_message:
Move tests into package dir.

This keeps it consistent with the other heat projects, and gets us
away from having a global 'tests' package.

Change-Id: Ic41b5fc235df0fce0feecfe678f743621e379aec

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-22 02:23:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new tempest flavor m1.little

Like m1.micro and m1.nano but it has 512 MB of memory.

"little" was chosen arbitrarily because "milli" isn't a colloquial term for
really small like "micro" or "nano"

m1.little will be used by the heat tempest tests to boot full ubuntu or fedora
VMs. m1.tiny is not appropriate because it now enforces a root disk size of 1GB.

Change-Id: I11ea5b79f9b578ef24374c43f80411d2dd6dccf6
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new tempest flavor m1.little

Like m1.micro and m1.nano but it has 512 MB of memory.

"little" was chosen arbitrarily because "milli" isn't a colloquial term for
really small like "micro" or "nano"

m1.little will be used by the heat tempest tests to boot full ubuntu or fedora
VMs. m1.tiny is not appropriate because it now enforces a root disk size of 1GB.

Change-Id: I11ea5b79f9b578ef24374c43f80411d2dd6dccf6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-27 14:31:29.000000000', 'message': "Fail validation when security groups and interfaces conflict

The 'SecurityGroups' property of the instance is not taken into account
by Nova when the 'NetworkInterfaces' property is also defined. Instead the
security groups should be applied to the network interface resource(s).

This issue has already raised a couple of invalid bugs on Launchpad.

Change-Id: I5ae2ba356518d391893c2a479c5952b13b6e8d55
"}]
commit_message:
Fail validation when security groups and interfaces conflict

The 'SecurityGroups' property of the instance is not taken into account
by Nova when the 'NetworkInterfaces' property is also defined. Instead the
security groups should be applied to the network interface resource(s).

This issue has already raised a couple of invalid bugs on Launchpad.

Change-Id: I5ae2ba356518d391893c2a479c5952b13b6e8d55

commit_message:
Implement Task and Resource managers.

Implement context and lock management around the manipulation of Nodes
via TaskManager and ResourceManager classes. Usage guidelines are added
as docstrings, with a single example in the ManagerService.

Part of bp:ironic-manager

Change-Id: I679ae94ed9ef1c814bc26529cd6360d02292ad40

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-15 20:57:44.000000000', 'message': 'Adding panels and api calls for role CRUD

This adds basic support for CRUD on roles for admin users.

The CRUD operations in keystone are only exposed without an
extension in V3.  So if the python-keystoneclient does not support
V3, the panel will not be registered.

Change-Id: Ibd727df1392ab9a748ab585620c1ff3dc57d3efb
Implements: blueprint admin-role-crud
'}, {'created': '2013-05-15 22:08:57.000000000', 'message': 'Adding panels and api calls for role CRUD

The CRUD operations in keystone are only exposed without an
extension in V3.  So if the python-keystoneclient does not support
V3, the panel will not be registered.

Change-Id: Ibd727df1392ab9a748ab585620c1ff3dc57d3efb
Implements: blueprint admin-role-crud

commit_message:
Adding CRUD for roles

This adds basic support for CRUD on roles for admin users.

The CRUD operations in keystone are only exposed without an
extension in V3.  So if the python-keystoneclient does not support
V3, the panel will not be registered.

Support for blocking create, edit and delete in LDAP case added.

Implements: blueprint admin-role-crud

Change-Id: Ibd727df1392ab9a748ab585620c1ff3dc57d3efb

commit_message:
Fixes boot from volume without image

Fixes Bug #1163566

I've also disabled booting from volume with an image specified
although Nova does support this, I've chosen to still disable it in
Horizon because it doesn't make much sense. Tihomir Trifonov also
noted this.

Change-Id: I17f3edbbb0cabe1cf415484f32016aab7a332ed4

commit_message:
Make the Settings form fully translatable

Also switch to using the _() gettext convention for marking
translatable strings.

Fixes bug #1183795

Change-Id: I1450cbd8410108ed95d431243b8a84541bdedbdb

I think this is a good idea, but I would prefer to see it just throw an error in the validate method. Logging warnings is nice, but they're only available to operators, not users.

I'm not worried about compatibility with AWS at this stage, because the implementation of NetworkInterfaces is already completely wrong for that."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-05-26 23:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Replaced by https://review.openstack.org/30625'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-24 10:07:10.000000000', 'message': "Warn when security groups are going to be ignored

The 'SecurityGroups' property of the instance is not taken into account
when the 'NetworkInterfaces' property is also defined. Instead the
security groups should be applied to the network interface resource(s).

This issue has already raised a couple of invalid bugs on Launchpad.

Change-Id: Iee5956fcfb0568c753612ea223d444cf20a2b579
"}]
commit_message:
Warn when security groups are going to be ignored

The 'SecurityGroups' property of the instance is not taken into account
when the 'NetworkInterfaces' property is also defined. Instead the
security groups should be applied to the network interface resource(s).

This issue has already raised a couple of invalid bugs on Launchpad.

Change-Id: Iee5956fcfb0568c753612ea223d444cf20a2b579

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-22 06:12:48.000000000', 'message': 'Renamed keystone_registration recipe

Renamed keystone_registration to identity_registration, and added
identity_registration tests.  Added registration tests to simply
test the args being passed to the `openstack_identity_register` LWRP.
The identity LWRP should be tested at a deeper level than the consumers.

Testing args passed to a DSL (&block) is a bit tricky. The tests
are not ideal, but give us the necessary coverage to catch common
errors.

Change-Id: I18db535ca1bab357ba083d57a76d86c5ccfddf15
Fixes: Bug 1182576
'}, {'created': '2013-05-22 06:33:38.000000000', 'message': 'Renamed keystone_registration recipe

are not ideal, but give us the necessary coverage to catch common

identity_registration tests.  Added registration tests to simply
test the args being passed to the `openstack_identity_register` LWRP.

are not ideal, but give us the necessary coverage to catch common

Change-Id: I18db535ca1bab357ba083d57a76d86c5ccfddf15

commit_message:
Renamed keystone_registration recipe

Renamed keystone_registration to identity_registration, and added
identity_registration tests.  Added registration tests to simply
test the args being passed to the `openstack_identity_register` LWRP.
The identity LWRP should be tested at a deeper level than the consumers.

Testing args passed to a DSL (&block) is a bit tricky. The tests
are not ideal, but give us the necessary coverage to catch common
errors.

Change-Id: I18db535ca1bab357ba083d57a76d86c5ccfddf15
Fixes: Bug 1182576

commit_message:
Copy the RHEL6 eventlet workaround from Oslo

Tests in oslo-incubator now need the horrendous hack to workaround an
issue with eventlet on RHEL6. We've moved the patch_tox_venv tool
and redhat-eventlet.patch into oslo-incubator, so add them to
openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I1acfec282b64d7582144b155119bedb1741db2f7

[{'created': '2013-05-27 08:57:13.000000000', 'message': 'Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Also sync the 0.7.x requirements to 0.7 (to be in sync with other
OpenStack core components)

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: Ie20344e96f3d12e93695579adff0a0d9b4c1c516
'}]
commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Also sync the 0.7.x requirements to 0.7 (to be in sync with other
OpenStack core components)

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: Ie20344e96f3d12e93695579adff0a0d9b4c1c516

commit_message:
Provide a config generator

This is stolen from Nova with a fix stolen from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30251/

Obviously the final goal is to stop copying this file into each project and
start improving it where it belongs.

Change-Id: I85d427aa87677e87d2b943441b68f37df578208b
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Do not warn about overlapping IP addresses usage

Metadata service supports overlapping IP addresses since blueprint
metadata-overlapping-networks. Security group supports overlapping
IP addresses since blueprint quantum-security-groups-iptables-lb.

Related to bug 1055822.
This reverts commit 4c679f618889d277c33964e510dc5b714956fcf4.

Change-Id: I516da3ae8d7766c985a90641e1f82503b2594134

commit_message:
Add the iSCSI session availability check.

Before executing the command "qemu-img convert", check if the iSCSI session is
still available. If it is unavailable, there is no need to do the
"qemu-img convert" and an exception VolumeSessionUnavailable is raised.

Fixed Bug1169290.

Change-Id: I8f6a2850913bebe92b5454f9e000a36f7240332f

commit_message:
Hack run_tests.sh to work with single tests again.

Even though we're moving to testr and this will eventually
go away, we should maintain our ability to run and debug
individual tests until the broader change is released.

This just adds some text around the nosetests call
to get us back where we were.

Fixes bug: 1181996

Change-Id: Id0082ca8954664679430cc602425b1fadd29151b

commit_message:
Update the oslo code before importing a new module

Note:
- there are some new oslo dependencies pulled in.
- "six" has been added to the requirements.
- rpc messages now have a "namespace" that conflicted with
  the metric namespace.

part of blueprint heat-manage
Change-Id: I92c6b91a28ca0380d13f0a3ba1544b9d517d74a8

commit_message:
Migrate test base class to testtools.

This is stricter, but also provides plumbing for more advanced things
like fixtures and testscenarios.

Change-Id: I607b50390708ca3caa9799ef0b27007df5045a6c

commit_message:
Remove eventlet dependency from unit tests

Unit tests should not need to know about eventlet. Instead of stubbing
eventlet.sleep(), stub out the TaskRunner._sleep() method in the scheduler.

Change-Id: I438a5d6978ed228d62a0d28fef30115d205bd2c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-27 06:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Allow ports to be created on networks that do not exist in NVP

If a network exists in the quantum database but not in NVP we should allow
someone to create a port on this network and set the status to ERROR. The
reason for this is if one deletes a network from NVP and when the dhcp agent
goes to create it's dhcp port on this network an error will be raised to the
agent and it will enter a constant state of resyncing.

This patch also adds a unit test for update_port() for the same situation.

Fixes bug 1179327

Change-Id: Ie77fc48d11644b820c0cc3b3fa341856e36f8511
(cherry picked from commit dbee58e7bb2ed1df6bb513247ec7ac07387ff5d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow ports to be created on networks that do not exist in NVP

If a network exists in the quantum database but not in NVP we should allow
someone to create a port on this network and set the status to ERROR. The
reason for this is if one deletes a network from NVP and when the dhcp agent
goes to create it's dhcp port on this network an error will be raised to the
agent and it will enter a constant state of resyncing.

This patch also adds a unit test for update_port() for the same situation.

Fixes bug 1179327

Change-Id: Ie77fc48d11644b820c0cc3b3fa341856e36f8511
(cherry picked from commit dbee58e7bb2ed1df6bb513247ec7ac07387ff5d1)

commit_message:
Collapse the whole repo into one file.

There were crufty scripts which we weren't using, as well as a
historical split of the requirements list into pip and test requires.

Also, tools/pip-requires is a non-standard name.

Change-Id: I6415f93c129da142802ed7676d589747ffe4ecdc

commit_message:
Make _build_network_info_model testable

This restructures the quantumapi _build_network_info_model()
method to be testable and adds tests for each of the smaller
components. It also provides verification for bug 1171636 by
ensuring that ports returned from the client that are not in the
set of networks passed don't cause the failure detailed in that
bug.

Change-Id: I82f20f68122fc38e72c31e52283529614252c174
(cherry picked from commit 43d657a11e953660f36683d595976c8bd8edb4cc)

commit_message:
Add support for requirements.txt.

In prep for moving the projects to requirements.txt and
test-requirements.txt, we need to have our legacy install_venv
codebase support finding requirements in the right place.

Change-Id: I0f300c6bb1792c81e2133a41a5631f2dd4c021ba
